review.title: Terrible noise from bank of lift wells
review.reviewText: Now I know why Expedia & Hilton could offer this room at a nice cheap price. You can't sleep in the room. Any room in the hotel with the room number of 00 (eg mine 1100) is right next to the bank of four lifts, which, of course, almost never stop operating, The result is that it is like trying to sleep next to a random, but frequent subway. This is the worse kind of noise to deal with, as any OHS or neurologist will tell you, because one can't adjust to it. Even with earplugs, the noise was unrelenting. I will always check in the future to make sure that my room is not located next to the lifts. I think that it is ethically incumbent on hotels, especially high end hotels like Hilton, and travel companies, such as Expedia, to alert their customers about the disadvantages of staying in particular rooms with particular problems, after all these disadvantages are the reason the rooms are being offered at cheaper rates..
review.positiveRemarks: The room was standard, the location convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: The bank of lift wells and the rooms immediately next to the lift wells could be MUCH better acoustically protected to reduce the noise from the lifts

review.title: Visiting San Fran
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel.  It served us well for 3 nights during our San Francisco visit.  The biggest negative was that even though we arrived after the 3:00 PM check-in time, our room was not ready yet and we were told it could be up to an hour before it would be ready.  After some head scratching, the front desk staffer assigned us to another room.  The bellman accompanied us with our luggage, but upon entry into the room discovered that this room was (or should have been) out of service.  The window curtain was falling down and there were unfinished drinks sitting about.  The bellman called the front desk and reported the issue, and we ended up going back down to the lobby.  After a awhile we were assigned to a room on the 23rd floor with a fabulous view of the bay.  This was worth the wait since our original room would have been on the 8th floor.

I like that there was one elevator from the parking lot and straight to our floor. We weren't able to get a bay side view of the ocean but the city lights were comforting to see through our windows. The pier 39 tajes about 20 minutes to walk there so I would recommend taking the bus or uber there. They do charge for parking and even more if plan on leaving in and out. review.title: Looks better from the outside.
review.reviewText:
We checked in about 2 hours earlier than the stated check in time which was 3 pm. Our flight landed around 12 pm. We took the BART which arrived at the Financial district around 1pm, hence why we were so early. The front desk staff member said we were a bit early, but still had a room available with the requested "Bayview." Unfortunately, we faced a huge building in front of us. Just a tad bit the the right of our view was the bay. I regretted paying extra for the, "view," since it wasn't what I was expecting. 

The room itself was fine. Nothing seemed outdated. It was clean as well. The odd thing was that there was only 1 night stand. Maybe the room was designed for a single person. I'm not sure. So it was a bit annoying sleeping without a night stand for me, since my wife slept on the side with the stand. I couldn't place a glass or bottle of water at night, but I made due with the ottoman. The walls were too thin. We heard our neighbors every morning. They were our alarm clock. 

We did have another hiccup with our TV remote. The batteries were low. We called front desk to have someone look at it, so they can replace the batteries. Several hours went by, nobody came. We did get a call from front desk asking if our issue was handled. We said no, nobody ever came. The person said they will send someone right away, but we were ready to explore the city, so we said that it's fine. To send someone later or hopefully when house keeping comes, it will be handled. Which it was!

Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Hilton SF.
Check in was quite complicated : first, our key didn't work, so we went back to the lobby to get a new one. The second key we got was working but it happened that they had given us a room that was already occupied ! Third time was the good one, we finally got our room.
The hotel is situated very close to Chinatown, and its location really allows to make plenty of things walking.
However, if you have a car with you, save some money, and go to the parking in front of the hotel ($27 / night, instead of $60 at the Hilton)
Don't go to their restaurant, it has really nothing remarkable, and SF offers so many much better choices to eat !
At last, we were surprised by the poor quality of the Wifi.

review.title: Exceptional Service
review.reviewText: My husband and I were celebrating our honeymoon in San Francisco and when we checked in I had mentioned this. The person who had checked us in called our room shortly after we arrived and asked us how we liked the room. We told her that it was a little small but it would be okay. She had advised that there was another room available but it would not be ready until later in the afternoon. We said okay and went to lunch, when we came back we found out that we were upgraded to the 26th floor with Executive privileges. We were able to go into the Executive Lounge for a free breakfast and and appetizers in the evening. When we initially stopped into the Executive Lounge, Delila greeted us and when she learned that it was our honeymoon sent us champagne and chocolate covered strawberries.I feel everyone went above and beyond and I was very impressed and happy. I would highly recommend the Hilton to anyone. Great job and keep up the great work.
review.positiveRemarks: The people and service were superb!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Close to financial district
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok.  I had to go down to front desk 4 times to get my keys re-done.  They consistently did not work after the first time.  They should have moved my room after the second time.  The night before I checked out I can back to the hotel at 5 and housekeeping had not come and they put a loud boxed fan of some sort in the middle of the room.  When I called the front desk they said it was a room purifier.   Now mind you I am gone all day to a class and am only sleeping here.  There was no order on the room.  They finally came to get the fan but I told them to forget the housekeeping because by then it was 6pm and I didn't want to deal.  They should have comped me a night for free for all the hassle.  They did not.  The staff was pleasant at the front desk but they should take better care of their guests.

review.title: Can't judge a book by its cover
review.reviewText: I expected a hotel called Hilton to be more than it really was. Paying the amount we did for each day seemed too high for the quality we got. The walls were way too thin for this class of hotel. The rooms were small compared to other similar priced a day hotel rooms we have stayed in. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were good and soft. Usually in a 4 star hotel we are greeted cheerfully by the admitting clerk. However, in this hotel we were greeted coldly and so matter of fact. I was disappointed, to say the least

The room beside us partied until 3am one night. Then proceeded to do the same the next night, they only stopped when we called to complain. They stopped for a bit and started back up at 5am. Made for a tough couple of days of sight seeing as we were exhausted.

They also forgot to tell us that we were given an accessibility room. I'm 6'2" tall and a 4" tall shower head just didn't work for me. Would have been nice to have been told in advance.....

review.title: Nice hotel but managerial service not up to par
review.reviewText: I chose the Hilton hotel to relax at during my bachelorette party weekend. We were told that we could arrive for check-in at 12pm and after walking to the hotel to check in from the CalTrain station, one of the staff told us that the room was not ready and asked us to come back around 3pm. We arrived back at the hotel 5 minutes to 3pm and the staff member was frantic and taking a while to check us in. I had to ask her what was wrong and she stated that the guest did not check out. After patiently waiting 10 minutes, I asked her why a room was not prepared prior to knowing that they were not going to check out as my group had dinner reservations in an hour and we had to get ready. Another staff member came over to help her and he gave me attitude as I explained to him that we arrived at 12pm and that it was ridiculous that we still have to wait and are not being communicated with on what is going on. We got our room keys at 3:25 and arrived at our room at 3:30. We were late to our dinner reservations. I explained my frustration the next day to the morning manager and he stated that his records show that we checked in at 3:05pm. The manager did not feel they needed to take any responsibility as he felt the staff did the best they could to accommodate me. This hotel provided the worst bachelorette experience for me as I was not able to relax as I wanted to and did not receive the upmost in customer service after paying $250 per night to stay here.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for choosing Hilton San Francisco Financial District. We apologize for the noise you experienced on the 4th of July. We hope that otherwise you time here was enjoyed.

I didn't have the best view, but some rooms probably have great views.  Gym was decent.  Free computers in the lobby helped me avoid paying for internet over the weekend.  Maybe best of all is the location. You are at the edge of Chinatown and a short walk away from the restaurants and clubs of North Beach.  You can also walk to Union Square or the Embarcadaro in 15 minutes or less.

review.title: Chinatown view
review.reviewText: This hotel is right across from a Chinese cultural center and it is about 6-7 blocks from shopping such as Macy's. I chose this place because of the proximity to my son's house and I couldn't have been happier. The room was very clean, the bed comfortable, and room service was top notch. I got a standard room with a double bed and it was pretty spacious. What noise I did hear came from the groups of people at the various restaurants, such as the steakhouse across the street or the Chinese school with the kids at recess. Very little, if any, noise from the hotel itself and I stayed on the 5th floor. I didn't run into the elevators taking a long time, as other reviewers did, even with several conventions and a very full hotel.  The concierge knows his stuff, so if you need directions or a fun place to go, he is your man. Taxicabs are usually waiting out front, so you don't have to wait and there is a car service that parks there as well. I didn't drive a car there so I can't comment on the valet service. You have to pay for internet service, but I used my mobile hot spot since I have unlimited data. Check in and check out was smooth, and there were no surprises on my bill. I will definitely stay again.

Sometimes you just don't like things and thats that, but the staff was great and I will return when I go back out to the city.

Shopping was an easy walk. Many shops near Union Square and beyond.

Needed key
Back to desk

Terrible experience   won't stay  here again

Woman clerk sent me back to front desk for key   - when I ate all my meals there the waiter gave me a key from behind the bar with courtesy-  Shame on her -I  know you don't want people off the street-  I was polite and don't look like I walked in off the street woman behind bar working about 10:00AM on Sat. Shame on her

Won't stay with you again

review.reviewText: My family and I went last weekend the hotel is ok but we check in late and they don't clean our rooms, then we call to housekeeper and they said no body can clean rooms at that time (9.30 pm) when I tell front desk lady she was rude, then she try to apologize for everything but nothing else, if  I paid for two ninths who cares what time I check in they need to check rooms an clean it, because they don't reduce cost for check in late or out early .

review.title: A quiet nights rest in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Staff was kind and accommodating. Although,  the lounge, bar, and reception areas all have mismatched outdated decor. The king room with a bay view was great. A whole wall of windows. I loved that. The location is walking distance to Chinatown, northbeach, and union square. However, a full round trip with a stop in each neighborhood in one afternoon did tucker us out! Lastly, a stay in the city without outside noise to keep you up all hours is hard to find but we did on the 12th floor. It's a good option for all of the above mentioned reasons if you can get a great deal.

review.title: Just OK experience and location
review.reviewText: Our weekend stay at the Hilton was for OL Music Festival. They rooms are small and the beds are smaller. The staff was friendly and answered any questions we had. I wish I would have known that WiFi would not be included, I probably would have stayed somewhere else. I was expecting something a little more in the Financial District, not Chinatown. Overall it was an OK stay but probably will stay at a different hotel next time.
review.positiveRemarks: They staff was extremely friendly and accommodating when we showed up 3 hours before check-in. Staff was also helpful with taxi service and luggage.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish the hotel would notify the traveler ahead of time that WiFi is not included in daily room rate. For the rate we paid I wish it was.
review.locationRemarks: Location is at the very tip of the Financial District, pretty much in Chinatown. I was expecting something a little different.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Judy,

Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. Our team is thrilled with the 5 star rating and generous comments about our hotel. We hope you will come visit us again during your next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Great view and convenient location!
review.reviewText: We spent 3 days in this hotel and we were very satisfied with everything. We slept in a two-double-bed room on the 22nd floor with a wonderful bay view. We absolutely loved watching the sunset from our room. The beds were really comfortable, which has never happened before. The room was cleaned everyday. In addition, the hotel is located near many tourist attractions. We walked to Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ferry Building, and many tours. It was awesome. Chinatown was right around the corner.

managementResponses.response:
Dear AJ,

Our team appreciates your taking the time to give us feedback to enable us to improve our accommodations and services. I am sorry to hear about your arrival experience and that our response fell short of meeting your expectations. We will share your comments with our team as an example so as to better respond in the future. We sincerely hope to have you as our guest again in the future.

review.title: Less than expected.
review.reviewText: Once you add in the parking and internet the cost is closer to $320 a night. There was a couple used towels left from the previous guest. The hotel gave us a $50 credit for the restaurant the inconvenience, however the breakfast was $65 for 2 people and wasn't very good. The bed was very uncomfortable. View and location is good.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kelly,

Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback about your stay to help us improve our hotel. Our team understands your points about the cost of staying in San Francisco and we are saddened that we did not exceed your expectations in terms of value. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience.

review.title: Great location and facility but have to pay 4 wifi
review.reviewText: Room was a little small and disappointed that you had to pay for wifi when you are already paying a lot for room and $50 per day to park.

the hotel was very good.. my only issue was I should of picked a hotel a little closer to what I wanted to see
I would say there again

managementResponses.response:
Dear Lina,

Thank you for your feedback. We are very happy you enjoyed our clean, comfortable, and well-located hotel. Parking is inevitably expensive in San Francisco compared to most major cities and we understand how that affected your stay. We will take your comments into consideration in improving our guest experience. We hope to have you again for your next visit.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, clean, comfortable, and very well located. My family and I spent there 3 days, we were able to walk everywhere. The only minus, was an outrageous parking fee. If you are booking this hotel, take into consideration that parking will cost you an additional $50 a day.

review.title: 5 day stay
review.reviewText: Very small rooms. Great location. Elevator was broken for at least 8 hours. Entire hotel had to take service elevator. They have out $50 dollar vouchers for the inconvienance.  Voucher did not improve my feelings on the situation.

review.title: Good times
review.reviewText: Within walking distance from all of our favorites places. The executive lounge was excellent.

review.title: Short San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located within walking distance to Chinatown and North Beach. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We would stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, close to financial area, chinatown and North Beach.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really.
review.locationRemarks: Great location within walking distance to all areas.

review.title: Caters to tourists and families
review.reviewText:
Next to chinatown, little Italy.  10 minute walk to union square.  25 minute walk to Fisherman's wharf.

No homeless around

Safer area compared to union square, civic center

Easy self parking that shares same elevator as hotel.  $50 per night which is cheaper than going rate of $60 now.

Not on a hill so easy walking as compared to Stanford Hotel, Mark Hopkins Hotel

Lobby is small and gets crowded

Bathroom has no fan

No Pool, fyi for kids

Easy to catch cab out front


Overall, this is a fine hotel for tourists due to it's location and safe neighborhood.  But if you want a swanky hotel bar scene, then stick with the Hyatts, Marriotts, Westins etc.

San Fran luckily is a great trip for a nice mini vacation and the sites make up for the lack of quality that was offered at the hilton downtown finical district which should be renamed to Hilton China town.

review.title: Great location & views
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfectly located in the Financial District and is close to several restaurants, bars, and neighborhoods. Their bayview rooms have gorgeous views of Coit Tower, the Marina, and Embarcadero. Staff was very friendly and nice. Private parking is a bit ridiculous, being $51 nightly. They should offer guests a lower price since its a public garage that your parking in. Don't forget to request a mini fridge because they are not provided for you.

review.title: Friendliest Service
review.reviewText: All of the Staff made us feel so welcome at the hotel. Probably the friendliest staff ever at a US hotel. Great bays ride view and the location was perfect for what we were looking for. Close proximity to Coit Tower and the Fishermans Wharf. Of course China Town is steps away. We will definitely stay there again and again.

review.title: Decent hotel, but not highly recommended
review.reviewText: Lack of free wifi was a big turn off. Parking was outrageously expensive...you could get it for 1/3 of the price in any of the four parking garages surrounding the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were nice with a clear view of the harbor if you were fortunate enough to get a higher room.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer free wifi and reduced parking.
review.locationRemarks: The Stinking Rose is a good restaurant a few blocks away but the hotel is in the middle of Chinatown despite the "financial district" name.

review.reviewText: Expedia cancelled one of our nights without permission. Took almost an hour to get it fixed at the front desk. Hotel was old and smelt odd throughout the hallways. Carpets were stained. Not a good experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Old. Not what you would expect from a Hilton Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovation.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient location
review.reviewText: Good location, right near Chinatown. Also fairly close to waterfront (Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, etc.). Very friendly and helpful staff. Would stay again without hesitation!
Good experience, would use again, is in financial district but also in China-Town
review.positiveRemarks: friendly, accommodating restaurant service, room layout, view
review.negativeRemarks: information about parking situation, overnight in hotel parking-facility is 50 $, street parking almost impossible

review.title: Nice central hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel in a good location to explore San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel in central location
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights with my sister in a two double bed room. Lovely bathroom with bath, very comfortable beds and soft sheets. Speedy room service and efficient service from reception, concierge and room service person. Very helpful in booking our town car transport to airport. Would highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Near to Chinatown, a good walk to the water and convenient for street car from Fishermans Wharf.

photos.caption: San Francisco Coit Tower & China Town

review.title: We got a great rate & view.
review.reviewText: We called last minute and got a great rate on a Friday. The room was very nice and clean with a view of the Bay and Coit Tower. Staff was wonderful. Location in the Financial District and China Town. Had great a Chinese dinner and shopped until we dropped. A fun day trip at the Hilton.
review.locationRemarks: Went to China Town one block over and had a fun shopping experience.

review.title: Fair, but not exciting
review.reviewText: The friendly staff was the best part of staying here. The room and hotel overall was sufficient but ordinary. The halls look yellowed with age. As a place to sleep, it's fine, but for $200 a night, some personality and a pleasant surprise or two wouldn't hurt.

review.title: Nice for vacations
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect to spend days of vacations. Perfect location to take bus and walk to different restaurants.

review.title: Excellent SF city choice
review.reviewText: In a great location a few blocks from Embarcadero, Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf I found this a very comfortable hotel with excellent facilities and spacious rooms. Even a good view over Telegraph Hill and the Bay. Some good restaurants nearby, but then SF has so many! The bed was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room, views, workstation desk and chair, sleep comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet wi-fi is a basic amenity that should be included these days - I begrudge having to pay more for it.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown on the door step, plenty of good restaurants and the Wharf a few blocks walk away

review.title: Nice Hotel

review.negativeRemarks: Room condition

review.title: Okay...

review.title: Nice hotel/not enough staff
review.reviewText:
Hotel is beautiful as well as the rooms. There were 2 separate workshops or conventions the weekend I stayed, however; and there were not enough staff people working in the restaurants.
It was impossible to get lunch on Saturday ....one waiter in the large restaurant! Room service was just as bad for some people that i spoke with. They received their lunch after 1.5 hours...just when it was time to go back to the seminar.
How could this hotel not know about this and plan for it???!!

review.title: A great hotel in a fantastic location.
review.reviewText: I loved the large room and view from my window. The hotel is close to City Lights bookstore and all the China Town restaurants and shops.
review.locationRemarks: Close to China Town.

review.title: Nice hotel, location somewhat deceptive
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, beds were very comfortable. The location is a little bit deceptive, however... it is located right on the border of the Financial District and Chinatown (more into Chinatown). The walls were pretty thin, but overall the rooms were very nice.

review.title: Had a wonderful stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. It was walking distance from Nob Hill, the Bart, Pier 39...

review.title: Hotel in financial district
review.reviewText: The staff give me an excuse of why they couldn't find my reservation, and check out the room they are not suppose to, I book two rooms with two check out dates but they decided to check out my guest even when I specify at the time of my check out which is two days before the other room. Their front desk was just not professional, they almost cost me a client!
review.negativeRemarks: If the staff can know what they are talking about instead of lying to the customer thinking the customer are stupid........I made my reservation!

review.title: Had to pay too much for overnight parking
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel considering we only stayed a couple hrs because of our situation. But as first timers to San Francisco we had to pay for parking with the hotel which I felt was a little uncalled for due to the fact that we we're staying there.

review.title: Chinese New Year Parade
review.reviewText:
Preparations were ongoing from Thursday at Noon until Saturday 5pm.
We weren't able to access Valet parking at 10AM that morning. My 80 year old mother traveling with us was forced to walk from the garage parking area. This was very inconvenient. We were told that 12:00 noon we would be able to access valet.
Then we pay for self-parking and it's $60.00/day!!!
Too bad the decision making will prevent us from coming there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Be more conscious of the hotel guests that have special needs. They didn't offer any alternative.
review.locationRemarks: We went to Little Italy for the rest of the day in protest. We will stay at the Fisher mans' Wharf Hotel next time.

review.title: Nice hotel right across from Chinatown.

review.negativeRemarks: Elevators. Need more for the amount of rooms there. Long wait

review.title: Perfect getaway
review.reviewText:
Came into the city to see Cirque du solei
With friends
Thought we would stay over and enjoy the city and not have to try and get back home in the rush. Turns out we made the right decision. Loved the show, just a short cab ride from the hotel, and dinner afterwards was a treat, again only a few blocks walk from the hotel. It seemed that their were great restaurant choices an every block. So it was hard to go wrong. Came back to the hotel for a nightcap at the bar, and then off to bed. It was very restful.
Next morning we all checked out early, they ler us leave the car in the parking garage until three. So we walked to union square for shopping and breakfast. There is nothing like Christmas in union square to put you in that holiday mood. It was like I said a perfect getaway.

review.title: Half marathon visit
review.reviewText: This is my second trip with Expedia. We reserved a room with a king bed 5 months ahead. When we got to the room it was two full size beds. It was just my girlfriend and I so we planned on needing just one. This is the second time this had happened where the room wasn't what we had reserved. It seems to me this might be a common thing with expedia. I called the front desk and they said there was nothing they could do. Don't expect much privacy in the bathroom because it's a sliding door. You could hear a pin drop in the bathroom from your bed. The room service was ok. The food was cold by the time it got to our room. The quality wasn't that great either. Now for the positives. It was clean and neat. Nice bed, comfortable sheets and pillows. Good complimentary coffee. Nice comfortable furniture. Everything in the bathroom worked great and was neat and clean.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. I am very sorry to hear your stay was less than excellent. I will make sure to share the comments with our Director of Front Office to insure this does not happen again. Thank you for letting us know. All the best.

review.title: Terrible Staff
review.reviewText: I would give this hotel a -5. I reserved this hotel back in April. I was told there were no more double beds available when I checked in. I told them I reserved the double beds and I paid for it so they need to give me a double bed room. They said they would find another room. They found a double bed room and I proceeded to my room. After about 15 minutes, a guest came in to my room. She said she was assigned to my room and has a key. I contacted the front desk, they apologized and they said they would make it up to me and would even apologize in person. I told them to make sure no one has access to my room. I left for dinner, came back and my keys weren't working. I think they disabled my keys too. They were so incompetent, they couldn't just disable the other keys. I went down to the front desk. The person I talked to was obnoxious told him the entire situation and didn't even offer an apology. He told me, I didn't assign the room to somebody else. That wasn't me (with an attitude). I felt very unsafe because of their incompetence. I kept thinking what if they assign my room again to somebody else and someone would come into my room again? I felt very unsafe. And the manager did not come back to me. I will never stay in this hotel again because of what happened and I didn't like the surrounding. It is very close to chinatown and the hotel lobby looks chinese also which is fine but the area did not look safe to me.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed is comfortable and the room is clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Well managed front desk with competent staff.
review.locationRemarks: Less than a mile to Fisherman's Wharf. It is right next to Chinatown if you want chinese food. The restaurants look decent from outside.

review.title: Conrad Hilton would be mad
review.reviewText:
Arrival was most excellent. We drive up to this massive structure in the heart of San Francisco, and the parking staff tells us to relax, we have arrived, there is no hurry. Our room was beautiful and well appointed, staff was always friendly and attentive. Too bad our ice machine was out of order on the 14th floor and getting ice to my room was a challenge. The next morning, the coffee creamers produced floating clumps of cheese in my in-room-coffee. "In-room-coffee?", you say? Yeah, the only other coffee I could find involved waiting for a seat in the restaurant, and we had no time. No ice at night, no coffee in the morning.
Otherwise our stay was amazing, and management is offering us a spiff for our inconvenience.
review.negativeRemarks: I had no ice. This should have created an immediate response, not an "out of order" sign.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: I stayed at the SF Hilton over a weekend. Overall, great hotel, very convenient location. Friendly staff. Hotel is across from China Town. Walking distance to Union Square and the shopping district. 10 minute cab ride to the Fisherman's Wharf. I arrived late in the evening, hotel staff was very friendly, even upgraded me to the executive floor (27th floor). Great view. Highly Recommend the Bay View.

review.title: Do not book the executive level!
review.reviewText: We booked a triple room (3 adults in separate beds) only to be told when we arrived that these rooms do not exist. Instead a rollaway was put in the tiny room so it was very uncomfortable. Reception was not very helpful and did not even offer the option to book another room. The room was on the executive level (which is an additional cost) and it was terrible. Minimal choice, food often ran out and was of poor quality and you pay for alcohol. I would have expected more from this hotel chain. So do not book the executive level! The hotel rooms, hallways and general appearance is tired although it’s in a good location.

review.title: First Visit
review.reviewText: Everything was pleasant, however we had to wait 65 minutes over check in time to get a prepaid room. Great otherwise. Offered comp breakfast and discount spa cards. I would return.

managementResponses.response: We are very glad that you have enjoyed out downtown location. Hope to see you soon again.

review.title: Right next to Chinatown and good Italian places
review.reviewText: I was pleased at the hotels location. It is within walking distance to Chinatown and several great Italian places to eat. What's not so great is the traffic. Be careful when out on foot and mind the other cars, as they may not notice you.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning systems in the room could use improvement. The thermostat on the wall controlled no part if the AC.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to Chinatown and many good places to eat.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We certainly hope to see you again in the future.

review.title: Comfy Hilton
review.reviewText: My husband and I were really pleased with our comfortable beds and overall set-up of the room. We had a great view of the San Fran. tall buildings and things were perfectly softened by the great high-tech shade system. We found it odd, however, that the hotel charged extra for using the wi-fi in our room, while it was free in the lobby. And, we would have appreciated a free coffee and tea station in the lobby. Instead we had to trek 6 blocks, round trip, to get coffee at Star Bucks. Small gripes, though. We will definitely go back!

managementResponses.response: We are very pleased that you have enjoyed our location. Hope to see you soon again.

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel close to Embarcadero, Ferry Building, Union Square as well as shopping and dining.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to provide your feedback. I will make sure to share your comment about parking service with our parking/garage manager.

Again, thank your for sharing your experience with us. All the best.

review.title: Good location. Parking is unreasonably expensive.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is very convenient thanks to it's great Chinatown location. Hotel staff is nice and polite.
Valet parking service is way too expensive and their service and attitute have a lot to be improved.
review.positiveRemarks: Location right in the center of China town.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound barrier between rooms. Next door neightbor TV can be heard just like right in your own room.
review.locationRemarks: Many good Chinese restaurants nearby. To wander around for gifts and souvenirs.

review.title: Great hotel in the Financial District.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was gracious and friendly. The room was clean and attractive. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and business acquaintances.
review.negativeRemarks: Explanation of self parking charges and excess rates would be helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Ferry Building, shopping and great North Beach restaurants!

review.title: Great location, some staff not so great
review.reviewText:
This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and we brought our dog this time. We were told when we checked in that we were not to leave the dog in the room unattended, and then had to sign a pet agreement. I asked for a copy of what I was signing so that I could read it. I read the agreement when I got to the room and it actually said something like, "If you are to leave the room the dog must be contained in a kennel with a sign on the door that says pet friendly room" This goes against what the woman told me at check in. They did not provide us with any of the pet supplies stated, such as this sign that goes on the door, a pet bed and bowl. We had a bed and bowl anyways but its just that it said it was supplied and it was not. Our room was very nice, loved the balcony. Bed comfortable, bell staff was very friendly.
We had to pay an OUTRAGEOUS fee of $60 for parking. Fine. But, upon leaving I gave our ticket to the valet to retrieve our car and when they drove it out, they parked it, left it running with the door open. They did not bring me the keys, they didn't tell me my car was ready, they didn't help me put my bags in the car...and they never even verified the car belonged to us...they just left it there in the hotel lot running and walked away. We were in a hurry to get to a wedding so I didn't have time to say anything to anyone about it...but I thought that was pretty shocking. Anyone could have gotten into our car and driven off.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to North Beach and China Town, also the Metreon.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your wonderful comments. We hope to see you again in the future.

review.title: Nice hotel in the Financial District/China Town.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the facilities and personnel. Location was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Enjoyed the executive level lounge and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: China Town is close by and North Beach. The Terminal Ferry and Market are 4-5 blocks away.

review.title: stay here its great
review.reviewText: Super hotel if you are looking and want to be sure of quality. Booked online and got a deluxe room for a good price which also gave me access to hilton club members lounge area. Thought about hilton union square but this was a better option for the price and its very near union square is very near. For food turn right out of the hotel and find columbus avenue for super italian restaurants. Highly recommend. Personally I would steer clear of fishermans warf hotels it was too full and crowded and touristy.

review.title: The beds were awful.
review.reviewText: The beds sagged in the middle and we aren't huge people. Parking was expensive and a hassle. We won't be back.
review.positiveRemarks: It is beautiful and conveniently located.

review.title: Comfortable and Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent. Room was clean and kept well for our week stay. Had a view of the bay which was beautiful. Also had a room for my son that experienced a lot of noise from other rooms. Our reviews would not be the same because of that but I loved my stay!
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were so comfortable. Great dining room. Staff was very helpful at the desk and the staff that helped with cabs, destinations were fab.
review.negativeRemarks: Fan in the bathroom would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: We were right by Chinatown and Little Italy...great dining options. Only a short distance from Pier 39

review.title: Good location but noisy.
review.reviewText: Bed are narrow, room is narrow, everything is small and with poor confort. You can hear what is going on next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed, noise
review.locationRemarks: Close to many intereting places.

review.title: Hotel in Chinatown. They call it the financial
review.reviewText:
Buffet breakfast was cold/ I had to tell the waitress to put it in the mocrowave. they did nothing for the later buffet folk. then they charged me $50 for two (cold) buffets
Their parking is $50/night with valets who don't know much. Across the stree the pucblic garage charges $27 overnight.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, buffet breakfast, parking.
review.locationRemarks: It's in Chinatown, hard by the SF financial district on Montgomery.

review.title: It´s just great to have so many restaurants around
review.reviewText: Well located, and amazing food around the hotel. Good service, great view.
review.locationRemarks: China town a must.

review.title: Perfect for our honeymoon!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a wonderful choice for our honeymoon. Rooms were very quiet and clean and the bed was really comfortable! The staff was very friendly and the concierge was able to answer all of our questions and then some! Easy to walk to popular locations and not far from public transit lines either. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the San Francisco Bay Area!
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable beds and extremely knowledgeable staff
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, it was great!
review.locationRemarks: Pier one was a quick 10 minute walk. You could get to locations like Fisherman's Warff within a half hour

review.title: Parking fees
review.reviewText: Parking at the hotel is $50.00 per vehicle, per night and that is for self park! Furthermore, you have to drive around to get to it. Across the street parking is 27 a day
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees

review.title: Too expensive parking
review.reviewText: Parking is very expensive, and no free wi-fi. Hotel is pretty clean and comfortable. Very close to china town.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wi-fi, decrease parking rate
review.locationRemarks: Close to china town, easy to get good food. Cross street has public parking, price is half of hotel's charge.

review.title: Good hotel for business and tourism
review.reviewText:
Although in the financial district also a good location for tourists as quite central, very close to Chinatown and not far from Market.

In general very friendly and helpful staff. Poor variety and value for money in the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant

review.title: Hilton excellent except expensive phone charges
review.reviewText: Two things dissappointed us with the Hilton on what was otherwise a enjoyable stay. Firstly the cost of Phone calls $5.20 per minute for overseas phone calls is excessive charging . Secondly Expreesso coffee was not available for our two breakfasts.The room was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive phone calls and internet
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, close to China Town and Little Italy

review.title: Nice Hotel in Chinatown
review.reviewText: Check-In was nice and easy. They happily stored our bags for us after we checked out. We had plans in the area but weren't going to stay the night. Parking was expensive. Valet was $60 a day and parking on your own was $50. So, if you are already going to pay to park a car, valet is worth it. The hotel tv selection is very limited as far as what you can see for free. They want you to pay extra to watch almost everything.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern and clean, accommodating staff. When we had food delivered to our room, they called us to verify before letting the delivery guy come up.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close in San Francisco. This hotel is in Chinatown and close to Little Italy.

review.title: nice staff, terrible net
review.reviewText: The stuff are really friendly and patient when I ask for some assistance. The room was clean and tiny. However, there's no access to Internet in our room, which means we have to pay again for wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: the Internet...
review.locationRemarks: enjoy Chinese food, all kinds of dilicious restaurants!

review.title: No free wifi, not the best location
review.reviewText: My main complaint is no free wifi at room. The hotel is next to Transmerica tower but the surrounds are not beautiful and there are too many homeless people around.
review.negativeRemarks: Free-wifi
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is next to Transmerica tower but there are many homeless people around. Union square is not too far but is not near.

review.title: Great property close to sites in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Easy walk to China Town, cable cars. Reasonable cabs to other sightseeing venues.

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO - BAGHDAD BY THE BAY
review.reviewText:
Our first encounter with the hotel staff was warm and pleasant. The gentleman, D.J., who greeted us at the front desk as we checked into the hotel was considerate, warm and attentive. He handled the process quickly and professionally while carrying on a friendly conversation.

The elevators were conveniently located and whisked us to our floor smoothly and comfortably. As we entered our assigned room, we were impressed with its cleanliness, organization and high level of maintenance - a tribute to the housekeeping staff. We appreciated the comfortable king-sized bed, big-screen television, sparkling bath and restroom facilities. All the necessary amenities were accessible and conveniently situated.

The location of the hotel was within minutes of several districts within San Francisco - the Financial District, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf, Coit Tower, Chinatown and the downtown district. The city's famous cable cars were within three walking blocks of the hotel's entry way.
review.positiveRemarks: We appreciated the hotel's convenient location, its friendly staff and the cultural significance of its thematic decor.
review.negativeRemarks: Facilitate the ease of contacting a hotel representative over the telephone. It took several attempts to connect with a live person prior to arrival
review.locationRemarks: See "our experience"

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location and comfortable beds. Would be better if the room has a small frig. The check in and check out are faster than expected. Overall a good stay .

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText:
The staff had been very helpful when checking in and accommodated out stay at higher level of the hotel and advised which side is quieter the hotel is in very good location only 5 mins from china town and cable car stop . 10 mins away from fishermans wharf

The room is really nicely kept and comfortable space for luggage, bathroom,
Office and to sleep would visit this hotel again
review.negativeRemarks: N/A

review.title: Poor customer service
review.reviewText: We paid for a bay view room. When we checked in, we received a city view. The first person we spoke with was very rude and said that he did not show that we paid for a bay view, and that there was nothing we could do. I wish I would've gotten his name so I could've officially complained to the manager. The second person we spoke to was apologetic. She said that she saw the bay view room rate on our reservation. However, there were no other bay view rooms available. They would not refund the difference, but they gave us 2 vouchers for breakfast. The shower was not clean upon first arrival. All other aspects were good. Decent location, but there are hotels that are closer to Wharf District.

review.title: Very good experience
review.reviewText:
Our room is bayview but only saw on the side and worst was the windows are dirty.
We had hop on hop off bus tour and the location is perfect, bus stop in front of the hotel. Cheap parking is in front of the hotel. Silent during the night.
review.negativeRemarks: Window, no fridge
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: PERFECT & AFFORDABLE!!
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly customer service, clean and just great in general. The price was also so affordable. I can't fault this hotel! We will definitely be coming back! :)

review.title: Trust worthy staff!!!
review.reviewText:
In my hurry to leave, I had left over $200 in cash in the safe along with all my gold jewelry.
I didn't even motive to the 2nd day I left.
The staff was able to retrieve it and keep it safe for a week till I came back for it.
I was so grateful and truelly confide in this hotel brand name.

review.title: NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY
review.reviewText: I was planning a anniversary trip. And for the first three nights, of our 4 night trip we stayed in a best western. And for our last night, as a grand surprise i took my wife to the hilton hotel. Since the price was significantly more (3 time' more)then the best western and we had such a great stay i figured the hilton hotel was going to be much better experience. I was wrong, the room, tv, bathroom, window where smaller, and nothing was complementary( Not EVEN THE WIFY) . The serves was bad all the staff seemed to hate there job.
review.negativeRemarks: serves,small viewing window,bathroom was small and the door does not close
review.locationRemarks: Was close to China town .

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: This hotel has really good location, crossing the street is China Town, 6-8 minutes to the Union Square, 8 minutes to the metro station, Cable Car is going around, 20-30 minutes to the Fishermans Wharf by foot......
review.negativeRemarks: Hardware is a little bit old.
review.locationRemarks: Very very close to China Town.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: This is in a nice location in downtown to walk out from. I walked through China Town, to North Beach and AT&T Park. I could have walked to FIsherman's Warf, or used cable cars.

review.title: Good Hotel for Work or Play
review.reviewText:
This Hilton is so much better than most I have stayed in. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Even the night person who answered the phone when I complained after 10pm that the people in the room next me where fighting really and yelling at each other The staff responded with reassuring words and tone that they would take care of it. And they did! No noise after secuirty visited the room next door.
Enough room for business guests. Large desks along the window.
The location is right next door to the International district and very close to North Beach!
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff were so freindly and helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive Breakfast buffet
review.locationRemarks: Perfect close to North Beach and International district

review.title: Noisy elevator
review.reviewText: Good hotel and location was perfect for my business trip. My review score is lower because the building is old and the elevator was extremely noisy - not good when all you're looking for is a good night's sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for my trip, great Chinese food across the street
review.negativeRemarks: noisy elevator
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for my business trip

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Location was excellent, 10 mins to Bart station, walking distance to many attractions and bus/trolley routes, great room, very modern and clean. Great service. Small gym.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Hilton Financial in San Francisco. There were a few things that we found slightly inconvenient (e.g. no mini fridge) but otherwise it was pretty good. We had a room with a king size bed with a bay view. Although it was a bay view, it was hard to enjoy the scenery since the windows were pretty dirty on the outside which took away from it. Otherwise, the service from the staff was really nice and helpful. The location itself was really good since it was pretty close to all the attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: The service of the concierge and staff. They were extremely helpful to tourists and assisted you in every way possible.
review.negativeRemarks: No mini fridge or clean windows to enjoy the view
review.locationRemarks: Pretty easy to get to most attractions. It was right by Chinatown and only a few bus stops away from Fisherman's Wharf and other attractions.

review.title: Good Food, Thin Walls, Rediculous Valet
review.reviewText:
The walls are very thin. This is an older rehabbed hotel, tiny non-vented bathrooms with a floating sliding glass door. Our bed squeaked, as did the bed in the room next to us and above us.

The food is excellent, better than many Hiltons I've stayed, and reasonably priced. Front desk staff, bar staff, service staff all great, but the Valets were rude, didn't help with bags, and they charge 60 dollars per night for Valet...and the valet closes at 10pm: which is actually the most absurd aspect of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to China Town

review.title: Great Hilton near the Financial District
review.reviewText:
I stayed here with a coworker on business and it was perfect for our needs. It's a bit of a walk from the Montgomery St. BART station, but completely doable. Nice lobby and hotel bar. Happy to see they had a spa (if only I had time to take advantage of it!). The beds were comfy and the nice, big windows provided a good view of the neighborhood. Lots of plugs for charging and a large desk. Some of the TV channels were fuzzy, but that's likely an easy fix.

Tons of restaurants nearby if you don't want to venture far. And not just Asian food, though you're in Chinatown. There's a Starbucks right around the corner on Clay St.
review.positiveRemarks: Nearby dining options and comfy pillows
review.negativeRemarks: A few fuzzy TV channels
review.locationRemarks: In Chinatown/Financial District: seemed pretty safe

review.title: Enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: The location is in the heart of China Town...very gross surrounding

review.title: WOW!!!
review.reviewText: Wow..The view was a killer. Up at the 23rd floor, can see one forth of the city. Walking distance to almost every where. Going back next year.
review.negativeRemarks: None..everything was perfect.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown...perfect spot.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: We had a good time and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The Valet parking attendance was exceptionally helpful (city directions; taxi service; assistance; information)
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel parking fee
review.locationRemarks: O.K., little too far to cable car, etc. We might choose a closer location, such as Union Square area, next trip.

review.title: Good business hotel in Chinatown
review.reviewText: Good business hotel in a comfortable location. Clean rooms with some minor issues in the room.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: No complaints. This was a repeat reservation. Would book here again
review.locationRemarks: Proximity to most areas in downtown SF

review.title: Good business hotel in Chinatown/Financial Distric
review.reviewText:
- Good location
- Good view from bay view room
- Comfortable beds
- Upscale toiletries
review.negativeRemarks: Front Desk staff
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Financial District. Convenient to good chinese food and my business location

review.title: Great hotel for couples or business
review.reviewText: great hotel in excellent location. clean and somewhat quiet.

review.title: Three star hotel with branded price.
review.reviewText:
1. Hotel is listed under Financial District. But it is not, It is located between China Town and North Beach. Its listing creates false notion of location.
2. The hotel charge premium because of the name, but it is 3 star hotel at the price of 4 star.
3. Comfort: not much better than 3 star hotel. It is noisy, I had to request change of room because I could hear almost everything from next room, this was 7th floor. Moved to 9th floor, still same problem. Additionally, the bath tub water drain was not working (can you believe?).
4. Customer service is not that good more considering it was first time visitor.
review.negativeRemarks: Bath tub and internet connection fee
review.locationRemarks: Totally out of the area that was listed. If you have to be in Financial District, select different one. This is toward China Town & North Beach area.

review.title: Clogged!
review.reviewText:
The most annoying event of my stay was the clogged drainage of the bathtub;by the time you finish your shower you are standing in anckle deep water. I wonder how the housekeeping staff manages to clean the tub properly and why doesn't report it to the Maintenance Department.
Food & service at the restaurant were very dissapointing:chicken looked microwaved and it was very hard & dry. There was only one floor waiter having already a table of 10 & 5 booked!!
Apparent lack of security at the main entrance since an unsavoury street character managed to sneek into the restaurant.....the female bartender had to call security so this character could be escorted out of the premises.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathtub drainage was clogged so by the time you finish showering you are in a pool of water above your anckles.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the Downtown area!....few blocks from Market St & Union Square. Definetely the hotel's best asset.

review.title: Good access to Chinatown
review.reviewText: The hotel and room were lovely. The one thing that I thought was 'chincy' was that we were going to a formal wedding at the Mark Hopkins Hotel. The doorman was unable to find a cab for us to go the 5-minute (uphill) ride, so they gave us a ride in the hotel's towncar and charged us $15. Since they were unable to service us with a cab, I felt the short ride should have been complimentary.
review.positiveRemarks: Upgraded to a larger room per the check-in agent
review.negativeRemarks: Should have offered a ride to the Mark Hopkins
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the Embarcadero and Chinatown

review.title: Kudos
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay in SF and could not have picked a better hotel. Perfect price and location. Look forward in staying with you again in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The lounge on 26th floor with all the great treats.
review.negativeRemarks: Extended time waiting on an elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect and midpoint to walk to all our sites.

review.title: Hotel needs some repairs
review.reviewText: An extremely busy New Year's weekend. One elevator was out of service the entire 5 day stay. An additional 2 elevators out of four were not working for part of the stay. The bedding was old and in need of updating. The bathroom door did not completely close. The house in room coffee was not quality. The hotel staff, all were working hard and were very nice and accomodating. The maid service and bell captains were very helpful. Homeless people agressively followed us back to hotel and into hotel, no one from hotel encouraged them to leave.
review.positiveRemarks: Location close to China Town shopping
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel needs some repairs
review.locationRemarks: Edge of the financial district, close to China Town.

review.title: San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel with lots of amenities but the pay to park is expensive!!! Location is centered close to pier, shopping, and nightlife. As stated before parking is a expensive and is charged nightly to your credit card in addition to the room rate. Parking lot across the street is half the price for an overnight rate but has little security.

review.title: Excellent hotel service and amenities
review.reviewText: Would refer any guest to the hotel without any hesitation.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located for accessing public transportion (no car needed) and for commuting to attractions.

review.title: Great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great location close to Chinatown, 6 blocks from Union Square, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. The prices was fair enough for NYE. The room was very clean and confortable. We had a beautiful view to Coit Tower and the Ocean. The only cons: the elevator took ages to come, there are 4 elevators, but I only saw 3 of them in use. We spent 20 minutes in the morning to come down because there was check-out time and the elevators came full. The other thing that I did not like was the parking fee of $50 dlls per day, but you can park in the garage in front of the hotel, they charge $27 dlls a day. We may also park in the street, after 6 pm and on Sundays is free. The safe box did not work and they did not send anybody to review.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking fee and the slow elevator
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Disappointing for a Hilton
review.reviewText: Sliding bathroom doors that do not close. TV did not work. Drilling in an adjacent room from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. Fifteen-minute wait for elevators. Beautiful views and terrific staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Condition of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Edge of Chinatown and Financial District. Walking distance to Embarcadero

review.title: Couples Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: Was very happy with the overall experience, the view, the staff and upkeep. My wife and I stayed here for a weekend and had no complaints. The hotel was easy to find (we were driving), it was in a good location for us (close to where we were spending time in the city). The room was really clean and the staff was friendly. I would stay there again...
review.positiveRemarks: The view, we upgraded to the Executive Level for a Room with a view of the Bay and thought it was well worth it
review.negativeRemarks: Parking. Its just expensive but this is true for all hotels in San Francisco so we parked across the street at a local garage and that worked.
review.locationRemarks: Borders the financial district and chinatown, its a short cab ride to the wharf. Thought it was a good location for where we were spending our time.

review.title: Elevator issues
review.reviewText: 2 of the elevator are not function. Creating a long wait to get off floor.

review.title: Bella vista?
review.reviewText:
I had a gorgeous view of the bay, obscured by a filthy window. Some windex will do the trick.
The location is great. Central to everything.
Walls are thin and sound and vibration come thru easily.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: good hotel ,near chinatown , it is easy to find delicious food.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and locates in a very good location. Excellent

review.title: Nice standard place to stay.
review.reviewText: It's a nice place to stay and the price isn't going to break the bank, but for a hotel like Hilton I was a bit disappointed, the interior in each level is not very modern, it's just standard, I would expect more than that. Our hotel room was quite nice and clean, service is exceptional there, I would recommend to stay there, although it is a tad far from down town San Francisco, but you can always catch the Muni bus or the cable car.

review.title: Good clean room but...
review.reviewText:
Room was clean and good. 2 problems- we were on the 8th floor and it was fairly
Noisy - walls are fairly thin and there was considerable noise from the street. There was only one functioning elevator and we had to wait almost 15 mins for the elevator
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy, elevator too slow

review.title: Close to Financial District, China Town
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The Parking is really expensive - $50 Self Park and $60 Valet inclusive of Tax, Easy access to China Town and North Beach,
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive Parking
review.locationRemarks: Great location for access to Financial District, China Town and North Beach

review.title: great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: nice hotel, beautiful area, good service, good food.
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: Hilton SFO Business District / Internet Charge
review.reviewText:
The only thing we didn't like is having to pay for having internet in our room (19.95 per day and per device!). otherwise you have to go to the lobby to use one of the six computers, not always available (3 of them very old and slow) What we expected from a Hilton is that internet was a part of the service Nowadays I think that paying for internet is something you expect to find in a three stars motel not in a highly rated hotel in a bussiness district The other thing we didn't like about this is that in the review they mention the internet as part of the amenities and you find out about the charges at check in... that's misleading information I think that Expedia should take care and prevent this from happenng

Besides this the hotel is great and the staff very nice and helpful
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff, umbrellas (don't worry, free of charge!)
review.negativeRemarks: Misleadin info about internet
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: great hotel, highly recommend
review.reviewText: great hotel in a great location. the staff was great and the room very clean and nice.

review.title: Great location, great view, and earplugs provided!
review.reviewText:
Plus: when I've stayed here, on floors 10 and 12, they provide what happens to be my favorite brand of earplugs!

Minus: Because of street noise, you need them!

I'll be back, though -- my company has a contract, and the place is very clean, friendly, and close to everything I'm interested in. And I don't mind wearing earplugs.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, and engineering was responsive to issues with a bad light fixture and the shower.
review.negativeRemarks: To charge my cell phone / alarm clock by my side of the bed, I need an extension cord. Why no outlets by the bed? Restaurant/bar service is VERY slow.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome. At the intersection of the Financial district, Chinatown, North Beach, and Nob Hill. Close to The Embarcadero, Market, and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Gateway to Chinatown
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Great breakfast take out food in lobby. Appreciated the availability of several free newspapers. Excellent internet access. Desk personnel were excellent with all reuests. Room was clean. Sink water pressure very, very low.

review.title: Geat locatiopn and good value
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at this hotel twice in the last year for weekend getaways and enjoyed the convenient location of this hotel. We got great room rates on Expedia both times. Basic rooms are just that, basic; but they are comfortable. They work great if you just use it as a place to sleep and do not plan to spend a ton of time in the room.
On our latest trip, the room was not ready when we arrived to check in so the staff went out of their way to make up for it. We will definitely be back!
review.negativeRemarks: Walls are thin so you can easily hear whats going on in the other rooms nearby
review.locationRemarks: close to all the best parts of SF

review.title: Great stay all around!
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hilton for business purposes but I would recommend to anyone visiting the city. The hotel was centrally located to some great shopping and various tourist sites. From the moment I walked in the door until I left the service was outstanding. The views from the room were amazing, I woke up every morning looking at Alcatraz. My room was the perfect size for one person and quite comfortable and clean. I will definitely plan on staying here for my next trip to the city.

review.title: decent business stay-not the best
review.reviewText:
A bit rough around the edges. Small things like the toilet seat not fitting correctly or staying up are annoying. For a property convenient for business downtown they nickel and dime the guest ($3 bottles of water in the room) with things that should be free like wi-fi (only free in the lobby, why?).

My room was VERY loud at night (even by NY standards) from street noise.

Overall, the rate was good, location good, but not first class.

review.title: Great Stay! Would reccomend for everyone!
review.reviewText: This hotel did not disappoint! Had a fabulous stay! It was just my husband and I, but would recommend for families as well. Located steps from the heart of China town, we even walked to pier 39. Was about a 20-25 min stroll, not too bad since down hill (would recommend a taxi back though). Parking is expensive, but your in SF, get used to it. Parked across the street in public garage for a fraction of the price but fills up by late evenings on weekends. I'm surprised that the hotel doesn't bring down the price of their parking to be at least somewhat more competitive. Parking for one night at hotel was over $60 w/ tax and public parking garage was only $27 max price. Would've gladly paid around $30-$40 at hotel for the sake of convenience. Slightly noisy also, we stayed on 26th floor and could still hear some traffic but nothing that kept us up/annoyed. Breakfast buffet in the executive lounge was good, cant complain about free food and drink. Lounge was too crowded to find a seat and was very stuffy but just brought our food back to our room. Cant say enough about the helpfulness and politeness of the staff! Everyone was extremely kind and willing to help with anything. Very clean rooms and nice, updated décor. Would definitely consider staying here again.
review.negativeRemarks: parking cost
review.locationRemarks: great location! Easy walk to many places.

review.title: never again...
review.reviewText: parking are expensive!!!!!!! parking!!!! parking!!!

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the hotel. Go location for our purposes. Rooms and carpet were a little worn. Good service.

review.title: Paper Thin Walls
review.reviewText: We could hear everything in the room next to us. Seems like there is minimal insulation between the rooms.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay very much. The staff was very helpful,freindly. and profesional. My room was nice and the view was impressive.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: Close to the embarcaderro and chinatown

review.title: Wonderful location and resturant
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, very good resturant, comfortable clean room with beautiful view.

review.title: room
review.reviewText:
room too noisy. window has some space I do not know why..... but too too noisy.
They tried to fix it but not fix it until we checked out.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Very god location, close to Little Italy & China town.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We had a great stay but the only downfall was the noise level in the room. There were even a set of ear plugs on the nightstand...should have been a clue.
review.negativeRemarks: noise level of room
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Adventures
review.reviewText: It was awesome and would go back in the future. That is all I wanted to say and stop asking me to write more.
review.negativeRemarks: Small double beds
review.locationRemarks: Unbelievable

review.title: Family friendly
review.reviewText: Great location... Friendly, helpful staff... No fan in bathroom didn't like that.

review.title: Couples Retreat
review.reviewText: Great location, close to everything. Not too busy or overcrowded.. Quiet and relaxing. Nice view. I suggest a fridge and microwave be provided in every room and a fan in the bathroom :) Iron & ironing board, hair dryer and free coffee were lovely. Sweet stay for a weekend getaway.

review.title: Retirement Celebration
review.reviewText:
Could not have asked for better service.
We hope to go back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was so friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to see and do it all that San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: Complete Disappointment.
review.reviewText:
The room I got was a "corner room" (as the bell-boy called it). It was tiny (it barely fit a double-size bed), and the bathroom didn't even have a proper door, but rather a sliding door that allowed sound and smell to permeate through the whole room. The problem is that such conditions were never disclosed during the reservation procedure. The price was smaller, but the only difference stated was that instead of two beds the room had 1. In addition, the room was also located right by the elevator shaft, so you could hear it operating all night long!
There were also no disclaimers about their parking belonging to a "third party" (ACE), so when they hit me with a $120 bill for two days of parking (!), I asked for "a break" but was told there was nothing they could do, and that I'd have to take the matters to the ACE management.
I'm never staying there again. I suggest that you look for other hotels. You will find similar prices for much bigger rooms. Moreover, hotels staff should also point out that public parking structures (such as the one located exactly in front of the above-referenced hotel) charge 50% less, and needless to say, that they do not manage anything related to such service.
Do your research and get a much better deal.
review.negativeRemarks: Deceit
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Very nice, safe place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Difficult to get to because of the hotel is in a busy part of town and on a one way street, but that is typical of most hotels in San Francisco. It cost $60 for 24 hours of valet parking. But again, that is typical of San Francisco where having a car is a liability. The hotel and staff are wonderful. Definitely would recommend the Hilton.

review.title: Great for business traveller
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel in China town. Really close to everything.

review.title: great staff, quiet area, pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Great service from the entire staff. Our room wasn't ready upon our arrival so they offered to comp us dinner before I had a chance to be upset. Service in the restaurant was great. They also gave us coupons for breakfast for our inconvenience. Right on the entrance to Chinatown and a quiet area for a noisy town. We had great views of the city from 18th floor bay view room. We were pleased and will stay here again when we return to SF. I comfortably recommend it to travelers that prefer to be in an area that isn't over run with vagrants and heavy night life- which also means we could get decent sleep while staying here. Highly recommend self parking across the street at public parking garage which is about half the price of the hotel though.
review.positiveRemarks: View from room. quiet area of town. great service from staff.
review.negativeRemarks: food in restaurant was nothing special- pricey though.
review.locationRemarks: relatively safe feeling area. literally the entrance gate to Chinatown can be accessed from a floor in the hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel, Horrible Elevators
review.reviewText: Quality staff, great room, beautiful view. The one criticism I would give is, though decently fast, there are not enough elevators for the size of the hotel. Wait times for elevators were significant.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We had a great time here. We had an amazing view of Coit Tower and the harbor and the ships coming in. Walking out the front door of the hotel puts you right in Chinatown. Easy walk to Market Street, Ferry Building and lots of other places. Easy to get access to any of the sites you want to see in San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful view and easy access to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby computers didn't work too well.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Chinatown with easy access to all San Fran tourist highlights.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Located in a great area! Room could have been a little cleaner....some stains on the furniture and some of the furnishings where a little outdated.
review.negativeRemarks: High parking fees
review.locationRemarks: Great access to all activity locations

review.title: H FD
review.reviewText: Great location to do EVERYTHING in San Francisco! Walking distance easy to all areas of San Fancisco

review.title: Jonesy tour of California
review.reviewText: Hotel okay but car parking is expensive. The bar staff are not the best as we could not get a coffee from the bar at 9.40pm when they closed at 10 pm as they had cleaned the coffee machine and would not use it again that night :o( Other guests in the room next to ours had a party until I complained to security and in fairness security got quiet within 15 minutes... also 6th floor is not high enough to avoid the street noise, when I complained the next morning, financial compensation was made. The concierge service was generally good and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: expensive car parking
review.locationRemarks: Central and ideal for China Town and is a stop on the tour bus route

review.title: A great place in SF
review.reviewText: Our assigned room had not been cleaned. The front desk very quickly assigned an other room that was perfect. Front desk was excellent. The hotel's restaurant was very good and fairly priced.

review.title: Prime Location!!!
review.reviewText: Excellent location on edge of Chinatown...walking distance to Financial District, Italian District, Waterfront. Also, many restaurants in the area

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: Hotel staff and cleanliness were up to par. However, the location of the hotel was a bit farther than I had anticipated. It was about a 20-30 minute walk to fisherman's wharf. There was not many options as far as restaurants and/or nightlife near the hotel, in fact, it was centrally located in the heart of what I believe to be Chinatown.

review.title: AWESOME hotel staff!
review.reviewText: This was an awesome experience! The hotel staff was the most personable, professional and helpful than any hotel that we have stayed at in quite some time! From the front desk, to the valet, everyone was wonderful! We will return for another visit, just for the service we received. Everyone we can into contact with was so pleasant and helpful. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable with all the amenities you could ever want. Can't wait to go back to SF and stay here again!

review.title: Good rate for anniversary!
review.reviewText: Good location. Just steps from the hotel you are in either the Italian District or Chinatown. The room was very quiet even on a weekend night. Nice place for a quiet drink before retiring, but know that the bar closes at 11:00 pm. Would be nice if they had local newspapers availble during the day. Otherwise great place.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet with a great view of the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: No local newspaper or small sundries store.
review.locationRemarks: GREAT location if you want Chinatown or Italian District. Bocadillo for tapas and the Bubble Lounge were good.

review.title: A night in the city!
review.reviewText: great room very modern decor, location is excellent to major tourist destinations, lobby had a variety of shops and spas.
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Hilton San Francisco Downtown/Financial Dis
review.reviewText: The hotel was located at the entrance to China Town, walking distance to Fisherman’s Wharf and 2 blocks from north shore(Lil Italy) we had a great time the staff was excellent from the moment we drove up to valet they made us feel like we were special, the front desk staff did the same. We were there early this sometimes is a problem but not here they gave us our rooms with a smile, for the next 2 days we felt special all the staff went out of there way to make us feel special. the parking price is $$ high but the city is always expensive, if you could take a cab to the hotel that would save you some $$ everything is close by...
review.negativeRemarks: Not anything
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Great Affordable hotel in the Financial District
