review.reviewText: The hotel was very accommodateing. It is in the heart of San Franciscos many attractions and wonderful restaurants. The concierge was helpful in recommending great spots to dine at and upon arriving I was upgraded to a room with a view. The only downside to this was having to wear ear plugs at night due to the noise on the streets. Parking is very expensive ($50) and I would recommend to anyone staying here to park across the street ($27). I would stay here again as the price for this hotel in the financial district is affordable.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, staff are great, excellent location, tour bus stops out the front.
review.locationRemarks: Great for business or holidays

review.title: Pleasant experience!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and amazing location. The receptionist gave us upgrade to the bay view room without asking! And the room was clean and comfortable. Overall we had very pleasant stay at this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charges
review.locationRemarks: Its in the middle of downtown, close to all major attarctions

review.title: Not a good hotel for families
review.reviewText:
not happy with the parking fee..$50 overnight and $60 for valet.. no in and out privilege even if your a hotel guest..during the day they have a $3 per hour rate but if you parked
overnight they automatically charge $50 which is double if you go by $3 per hr rate ..
review.negativeRemarks: the parking
review.locationRemarks: near chinatown in downtown SFO

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was centrally located for us as first time tourists. We were able to walk to chinatown, North Beach, and the Fisherman's Wharf. We walked from the Ferry station and AT&T park to the hotel with no problems. The staff at the hotel were very helpful, especially the concierge, Joel. He helped us book a sold out Alcatraz tour and guided us in using the public transportation. We booked a standard king room, but were given an executive level room on the 25th floor. The view from our hotel room included Bay bridge, Alcatraz island and the city. Magnificent!
review.positiveRemarks: The view, staff and modern upgrades to this hotel were great
review.negativeRemarks: No airport shuttle
review.locationRemarks: Great for business or tourism

review.title: As expected for a hotel of this caliber
review.reviewText:
We were very happy with our stay. The room was very comfortable and we had a wonderful view. The staff was friendly and helpful. Everything was exactly what one would expect from a room of this caliber. The beds were EXTREMELY comfortable, and the pillows were the most comfortable pillows I have ever used!

Two complaints: (1) We were on the 19th floor, yet we heard street noise quite clearly. There was a street party going on the Saturday night we stayed -- no music, but plenty of loud voices and laughter. We could hear it clearly in our room until almost 3:00 a.m. (2) The items we ordered on the breakfast menu were not available to us, so we left and ate breakfast elsewhere.

PARKING SUGGESTION: Use the parking lot directly across the street! We paid half the cost for parking that the hotel was charging.
review.positiveRemarks: We had a spectacular view of Hoit Tower and the bay. Plus, the pillows were the most comfortable ever!
review.negativeRemarks: We could hear street noise quite clearly throughout the night on the 19th floor.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, central location. Right across the street from an extremely affordable parking lot.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it was amazing. The room was great and very comfortable. It is definitely not the fanciest hotel, but it was great for the two days. It is also in a great area, and was close to tourist attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Great citywide and Bay views!
review.reviewText: We always stay at this hotel as it is so welcoming and very centrally located to where we want to be. The views are definitely a draw as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, easy to find, great views!
review.negativeRemarks: needed a hotel key to access restrooms in the dining area...
review.locationRemarks: perfect location; son works in the Financial District; easy access to Chinatown, public transportation to the America's Cup

review.title: Not the best
review.reviewText:
The front desk basically said hi, here's your key and this is how you get to your room. The person next to us was getting a run down about the hotel and Inclusions. We walked away thinking if we got any of that which we figured out ourself that we did.

We were put in a room that backed onto the elevator which was so loud of a night! We were 24 floors up and could still here the people on the streets!

We also went to their resturaunt at the hotel, service was not that great either. We stood there waiting to be seated, the waiter just kept passing us, I asked do we take our own seat and he replied yes. When we got seated he took awhile to actually bring us a menu.

Lastly we were walking out the door and a business essman was behind us, the doorman looked beyond us to the businessman and asked would he like a taxi, he didn't but wr had to get our own.

Overall the hotel is great for businessman but if younger like us at 23, you probably wo t get any service at all. If you do however choose to stay here and sightsee. Get the city sightseeing hop on hop off bus. This bus stopped right out front of the hotel and all the tourist spots for $28! It was so much fun!
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: To get to major areas it's about a 20 min walk. Not close to many places

review.title: Nice hotel and better price
review.reviewText: This is a gem near the financial district. The hotel is old but this is good because the rooms are bigger compared to new style hotels. Only downside is parking. It is $50 to park at the hotel. Better off parking across the street at $27 per night

review.title: Not for families...
review.reviewText: generally ok but charging for internet, overcharging for parking and concierge service is bad.
review.negativeRemarks:
charge for internet.
overcharging for parking
concierge service lacking.
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Great location in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location. Just across the street is Chinatown and North Beach is just a couple blocks away. Had an amazing view of Coit Tower and Alcatraz from our room! The only thing I wished my room had was a small refrigerator to store my leftovers.

review.title: Great Hotel in a great location with a great price
review.reviewText: It located in a convenient area with the nice conditions , plite Services and reasonable price.

review.title: Great downtown location
review.reviewText:
The staff was very helpful, pleasant and professional.
**I did see one maid pull something from a room she was cleaning bring it out of the room and down the hall to show another maid?! That made me uncomfortable. They should not be looking through guest stuff nor remove it from room for any reason!**

The bathroom had no fan and the height of shower head made it difficult to shower daily, now if you were 5 foot or shorter it would of been fine.
review.negativeRemarks: No pool and the Fitness Center was a joke for the price per night. My tiny apratment complex has a bigger and better fitness center.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. Walking distance to the piers and many other attractions.

review.title: Great Local but thin windows
review.reviewText: Very much enjoyed the hotel. It was always clean and the 26th floor lounge was great. The ONLY issue was pretty bizarre. The windows were so thin that even from the 17th floor you could hear the occupants of Chinatown marching around and beating their drums and tamborines morning and night. You may find this funny until you realize that it was louder than anything I've heard in Midtown Manhattan to include sirens, taxis, you name it.

review.title: OK for the price not stellar!!
review.reviewText: This hotel had exceedingly small rooms, (at least mine was) awkward to move in reminded me of European Hotels. They(Hilton) would not grant honors points because I booked the room on Expedia!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located for business or conference travelers
review.negativeRemarks: Did not seem particularly safe in that area of San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: as above

review.title: Would not stay there again
review.reviewText: We paid extra for a view of the Bay, but the windows were so filthy you could not even see out of them. When we inquired if another room was available, they told us another room might be available after 3pm, but they "couldn't guarantee that the window would be any cleaner"? Really? The room was also extremely loud and we had a lot of loud constrution from the street below. I hate to sound so negative, as we are really not that picky, but this was really disapointing.

review.title: leisure traveller
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel. I took my 18 year old daughter to San Fransciso as a graduation present, and we loved the location and our room. We where able to walk everywhere: Chinatown-2 blocks away, Littly Italy-3 blocks away, Union Square-1/2 mile away, Ferry/Pier 1 - less than 1 mile away. We even walked back from Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel staff was wonderful and very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: staff/beds/view, we where on the 20th floor facing the ocean and Coit tower. Breathtaking!
review.negativeRemarks: we had 4 window panes, and only 2 where clean...odd
review.locationRemarks: The best if you want to walk to everything, I mean everything!

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: Great hotel, awesome staff and fabulous location within walking distance to most everything.

review.title: Good location, confusion amongst the staff
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was fine, and was a perfect location for all we wanted to do in the City. Very bad experience with the staff at the two bars downstairs. Went back and forth twice, was told the wine bar was open twice, but when I went there was told it wasn't open yet even though it was clearly 30 minutes after the listed opening time. Then watched the bartender serve another woman, only to then tell me that the bar was closed. Hmmmm....
review.negativeRemarks: Bar staff
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown

review.title: How could they forget to clean my room?
review.reviewText:
Hotel was generally clean and well kept, except as noted below, but what do you expect for the price?

I was dissapointed, though forgiving, to discover that the switch to raise and lower the electric-powered blinds in my room did not work. Even after I called the Front Desk to report this, it was not repaired during my 3-day stay. Thank goodness that it was the shade and not the blackout curtain that malfunctioned!

The windows were also insufficiently sound-proofed. Although I was on the 25th floor, I could still hear the Chinese-style music in the park across the street in the afternoon/evening (totally understandable; we were on the edge of Chinatown!) and trash and recycle trucks early in the morning.

But the worst part of it was that my room was not cleaned / freshened up one day! I returned late in the evening to find the bed still unmade and used towels on the bathroom floor where I had left them. The front desk offered to have someone come immediately to attend to the room, but who wants that process to start at 11:30 at night? This is one thing that simply CANNOT be allowed to happen.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was quite convenient for my travel needs, and generally well kept, except as noted.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price of the hotel stay, how could they forget to clean and freshen up my room?
review.locationRemarks: Location of hotel was extremely convenient for my travel needs. Felt safe in the neighborhood day and night. And SF is a great city.

review.title: Good hotel for family.
review.reviewText: The room was small but comfortable. Traveling with family which includes two teenage boys. There was enough room to sleep us comfortably (with one son sleeping on a small couch without problems). The room with two beds does not allow for a cot. The view from our room was spectacular looking out at Coit Tower and the bay. The only problem was the elevators were slow and occasionally packed.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators
review.locationRemarks: Nice location at the edge of Chinatown. Close enough to walk to the Ferry Building and Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel, great value, great location
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect except the windows were really dirty; which diminished the beautiful view of the Bay. I loved this hotel and will return whenever I'm in San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: The windows were really dirty
review.locationRemarks: Bay View Room, 14th floor

review.title: Worked nicely for our honeymoon.
review.reviewText:
The hotel accomodations were very nice. The location being adjacent to the Chinatown was a good experience for myself and my wife. The only point of concern I had was that I initially intended to self-park as oppose to valet so I could have quicker access to our car for other parts of our trip and was given incorrect directions to the garage. Ended up valeting anyway and it made no different (except for a slight increase to cost). I would go back here!

It is located not too far from Pier 39 and the other Bay attractions, museums, etc. We mostly walked and had little problems. The street car system and other modes of transit are readily accessible as well.

review.title: good option for stay
review.reviewText: They did not have the room we reserved. In addition to an upgrade we also got vouchers for breakfast. Room was clean and staff were courteous.
review.negativeRemarks: parking is expensive

review.title: Too many extra'$$!
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were great, but the sticker shock of the parking charge and the wi-fi room charge were outrageous. It said free wi-fi, but that was only in the lobby! They wanted an extra ten dollars a day per electronic device. For a family of three, that's thirty dollars a night! Add that to the fifty dollars a day parking charge and it bumps the price an extra eighty dollars a day!!!

review.title: Great hotel location to see all of San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Overall, a great experience with a lovely view of the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay for in-room wi-fi and hotel parking.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Financial District

review.title: I have made a right choice
review.reviewText: Good location, good hotel, free wifi in public area, 10mins walk to metro. Will certainly come back again. One of the pickup point for hop on/hop off bus.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Is near to china town and financial district.

review.title: Room with a View
review.reviewText: This was our anniversary weekend, so we wanted to be in a place that was special. The first room they gave us was on the 6th floor and the windows were filthy dirty. I went down to the reception and asked for a different room, which was a little higher (8th floor) still had windows that were dirty and the view was not toward the Bay, which is what we would have wanted, so I went down again and asked for a different room. This time we got one that had clean windows with a view of Coit Tower and the Bay. I just wish this would have been the room we got to begin with. The view was spectacular and made the stay worth it. The room was comfortable and clean, but it was somewhat noisy and I assume that the lower floors are even noisier. The hotel is in China Town in the heart of SF near North Beach, great location.
review.positiveRemarks: VIEW (Make sure you're on the North side)
review.negativeRemarks: Negatives: No free internet access in the room, just in the lobby, no complimentary parking (it's an extra $45 to self park in the garage).
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in China Town in the heart of SF near North Beach, great location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Overall a good hotel. Not pretty from the outside but nice inside. Staff all helpful. We were upgraded to a bay facing room.

review.title: Don't stay there.
review.reviewText: It was clean and the staff was good, however the toilet was broken (when it flushed it took a lonnnnnnng time to reset) the water in the shower didnt get very hot, the pillows were nice but the beds were horrid they sagged in the middle. My back was killing me I would rather the hotel have bad service and good beds. There is nothing worse than getting a bad nights sleep. I was in San Fran on vacation and dreaded going to bed at night I was tired all the time. I slept on the little couch the last night because the bed was so bad. I couldnt leave the hotel because I prepaid. Couldnt wait to leave.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds
review.locationRemarks: Hilton in China town. San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Great costumer service. Nice, clean hotel.
Bar looked nice but drinks were over priced.
Beds were too soft and uncomfortable.

review.title: Room 1800 may be haunted...
review.reviewText: We did a last minute search for a hotel in the Embarcadero area and decided to try our luck with the "Expedia lottery special" – Its a 4star hotel, but we won't tell you where until after you book it. Of course, we get the one hotel that is furthest from it. But it's $100 cheaper than the listed prices. Good deal. What wasn't good was that there was only a double bed available (OK, I can bend), the TV would not stay on - turning off every 5 minutes. Then It went on at 2AM. We then got 2 wake up calls at 5:30 and 6 am. The following day, I call to get the TV looked at. A simple reset and it works fine. Then, the next morning, we get the same loud automated wake-up calls. I call the front desk to find out why - the operator says no wake-up calls were in the system for our room. And wouldn't you know it, the TV was back to it's funky ways in the morning. Avoid room 1800.
review.negativeRemarks: Broken TV and unrequested wake-up calls
review.locationRemarks: Near the heart of Chinatown. It's dirty, full of bums and full of culture.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: I loved it. Rooms were fantastic. Great view, great quality of everything, great staff and very helpful. Very happy with everything!

review.title: Good hotel to come back again.
review.reviewText: Very good hotel with good location. Meet our expecttions. It will be better if the front desk staff had more knowlege of the local sight-seeings and how to get there.

review.title: Problems with telefone fees
review.reviewText: The Hilton tried to charge me international telefoncalls over 60 $, despite the fact we didn`t use the phone at all. After a longer discussion they cancelled the invoice and didn`t charge the money. Thanks to the nice lady at the reception, who tried to help me! To deal with this issue took a lot of time and ruined my mood of the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: the view to the fransisco bay
review.negativeRemarks: the discussion about telefone fees

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in an excellent location. Close to little Italy, China Town and a short walk to Fishermans Wharf and union Square. Great views of the bay from our room on the 26 floor. The beds are very comfortable.

review.title: Special touch for birthday
review.reviewText: This hotel was booked for my daughter as a birthday present since they were going to the city for two Giants game, upon checking in the manager notcied it was her birthday and immediately upgraded her room. She found the staff to be very delightful and welcoming.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText:
Parking is expensive, staff although competent did not go out of their way to be accommodating. Not bad service but not quite what I an used to with a Hilton property. Location is fantastic for business travelers in that it is a quick walk to the Embarcadero center.

I would stay here again but it would not be my first choice. Also they will not acknowledge Hilton Honors for bookings through Expedia
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are well laid out to maximize space

review.title: Pleasant experience.
review.reviewText: It is a great place to stay. Overall, the experience was pleasant
review.negativeRemarks: The street noises which I realize the hotel cannot control.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was located within walking distance of my work.

review.title: US Open
review.reviewText: I little problem checking out with parked car. Wanted for me to pay separate even though I had my card at front desk. Not good

review.title: A traveler from Seattle
review.reviewText: It was an okay experience to stay in this hotel. Wifi is not enabled on the hotel room by default. You have to explicitly request / pay for enabling Wif in your room.

review.title: Loved this hotel
review.reviewText:
We had the best view in all of San Francisco! Wish our windows were cleaner to enjoy it more.

The hotel staff was great and the location was better than had we stayed in Union Square. We were right in China Town and block away from Little Italy. Union Square was in walking distance and Fisherman's Wharf was about a 10 min hike.

We will definitely be staying here again when we go back to SF
review.negativeRemarks: dirty windows
review.locationRemarks: next to China Town blocks away from Little Italy

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText: We arrived at 9-30 p.m., and our room wasn't been ready. They apologized and suggested us to walk around 40 min

review.title: Great location. Incredible views.
review.reviewText: If you your traveling for business this Hotel puts you in walking distance of the bustling Finicial District as well as recreational parts of the city like the wharf and the Embaracdero. Also the best views in the city, ask for a view of the Bay.

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: Conveniently located. Very comfortable and spacious room with great view of water.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough lighting in room.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location, close to Union Square and China Town.

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: The Hilton Hotel was pleasant stay, nothing extraordinary but clean and comfortable. I was especially surprised by its quietness = we could not hear any people in the corridor or other rooms. I wish they had given us a room on a higher floor, though. The only point to criticize: No room service after 11pm! and the restaurants are closed, too so if you are planning to arrive late, be prepared. Our room had no fridge or mini-bar and internet came with a fee.
review.locationRemarks: Location is convenient, next to Chinatown and ten minutes walk to the Ferry Building.

review.title: A nice hotel for a business stopover
review.reviewText: Stayed here 1 night for a business trip. Check-in was easy. The room was nice. The view on the 10th floor was a not so nice view of a bunch of other tall buildings. The bed was OK. The shower varied hot and cold, but it was the busy time at 6am on a weekday. Check-out was easy on the TV. Overall a really nice hotel, and the price was comparable or better than the other hotels in the area.

review.title: SFFinancial Dist/China Town Hotel
review.reviewText: Were very disappointed in the room assigned, tiny, one double bed, for had booked same Hotel last year through Expedia and had a two double bed room with wonderful views. Fortunately we complained and were relocated in a double bed room with a view of the bay and Coit Tower on the 6th floor. The hotel is very upscale and conveniently located, very much enjoyed our stay. Recommend eating across the alley at Alfred's Steak House, wonderful restaurant, very friendly staff and fairly priced with excellent steak and salmon.
review.positiveRemarks: large, well decorated comfortable two double bedrooms
review.negativeRemarks: one double bed room, no view, very small
review.locationRemarks: excellent for walkers

review.title: A room with a view
review.reviewText: Nice room with a beautiful view over North Beach from 12th floor. Refridgerator and coffe maker missing. Due to the bed construction you may hear lot of noice from your neighbours but you ear protection is included, Lunch buffee Mon-Fri is superb.
review.positiveRemarks:
Nice room with a beautiful view over North Beach from 12th floor.
Lunch buffee Mon-Fri is superb.
review.negativeRemarks: Refridgerator and coffe maker missing. Due to the bed construction you may hear lot of noice from your neighbours but you ear protection is included,
review.locationRemarks: Good location in downtown SF with lot of cheap and/or good restaurants

review.title: Not 4 stars
review.reviewText: Just ok nothing special about the whole experience. Certainly not 4 stars.I was hoping it would be nice based on expedia's 4 star rating. Pretty much disappointed.the water pressure was week and hot water wasn't even hot.

review.title: Use the earplugs they leave on your pillow!
review.reviewText:
As you arrive youll find ear plugs on your pillow. You may chuckle in ignorance but in my 18 months of living in hotels I've never stayed somewhere so LOUD!

2 out of the 3 mornings I was there I was able to make out, distinctly, each word that was said through the microphone downstairs at some rally. I asked to move around 9 that 2nd morning to a new room and NEVER received a call from the front desk offerng to accommodate.
review.positiveRemarks: That somehow, through an act of god, this Hilton was granted a 4 stars while acting as a 2.
review.negativeRemarks: Necessity of the earplugs!
review.locationRemarks: EARPLUGS!

review.title: too bad
review.reviewText: the hotel looks like 3 star hotel. a little bit old. One of the important thing is too much noisy. The noisy from everywhere including everything (sexy noisy).

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText:
Positives:
Literally next door to Transamerica. Convenient to Chinatown, North Beach, Montgomery BART, and other points of interest. The lobby is very nice and while I didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, it looked nice and the wine bar/snack bar was great. Hotel staff were polite and helpful.

Negatives: Uncomfortable bed + pillows, traffic noise, lots of construction noise from next door (the hotel provides complimentary earplugs, but they can only do so much), slow elevators, and a somewhat awkward room layout (though I was staying in an accessible room, so the non-accessible rooms may be somewhat better.) If you can request a room on an upper floor, do it - I think the noise factor would be seriously reduced.

You can't beat it for convenience to the financial district, which was my primary factor in booking this hotel for business. The construction noise isn't too much of a factor if you are getting up early for work. But I would not recommend this hotel to vacationers. There are better choices.

review.title: Great time
review.reviewText: close to chinatown and north beach good food!! and staff very helpful and friendly!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable for the price, in good location, and great staff.

review.title: Hilton sf
review.reviewText:
Good locatin.
Too noisy. Staff is not up to Hilton standards. Specially the housekeeping.
$45 for over night parking. You are better off using a taxi.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping and noisy rooms.
review.locationRemarks: In Chinatown. Walking distance to union square and little Italy.

review.title: Pleasure is San Francisco
review.reviewText: perfectly located, superb view to bay, Starbucks coffee in the lobby

review.title: Hilton has staffing problems
review.reviewText: 15 minutes after checking into the room a house keeper let themselves into the room without knocking and scared my 5 year old son. Even when I let him know someone was in the room he came all the way in. When I let the front desk know he said he would give me a 100 credit toward dinner and log it into the computer. When I went to check out they had no record of the event and wanted me to pay for dinner charges. I had to wait until the manager showed up and explain to him. I previously have stayed in hilton in Hanoi the 4 different times I went to vietnam. After similar things happened I have started staying at another hotel that is cheaper and nicer with none of these problems.

review.title: Chinese new year parade
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staffs. Elevators can be very slow with high occupency.
review.negativeRemarks: Insulation is not great.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

photos.caption: bay view from our bay view room, if you stand on left hand side of the window
Noisy building construction across the way
av console for hooking up to the TV

review.title: Convenient but, Noisy Location and Nice Rooms.
review.reviewText:
Stayed here last weekend for a quickie trip. The hotel is just on the border between Chinatown and the Financial District. You have a choice of dozens of restaurants within a two block radius. We got a bay view room that did offer nice views of the bay but, also of the building being constructed across the way. We were on the 19th floor nearest the elevator. If you get a bay view room, try to get a room farther away from the elevator and as high up as possible.

The room was immaculate and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. You do a get a fair amount of street noise and the construction crews on the building next door start at around 7:00 so you don't a get a room on the north side of the building if you were planning on sleeping in each morning during weekdays.

You have to pay for wifi and if bring a laptop, bring your VGA or HDMI cable as they make it easy to hook up to the flat screen TV. Bring some movies as they'll charge $12 or more per movie with a few exceptions

The embarcadero is about a 15 minute walk and several buses pass in front of the hotel. The cable cars run nearby on California if you want to give that a spin.

All in all, it was a nice weekend getaway.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable bed and very clean and updated rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: the noise from the street below and the building construction across the way. Wifi access is not free.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located between chinatown and the financial district

review.title: No so much
review.reviewText:
Windows were filthy, leaving us with an unsightly view.
Something about $12 per/day per/device for Internet
Called room service asking for extra towls that never came

review.title: Would recommend to anyone and everyone!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I arrived late at night to be greeted by welcoming and professional doorman. We told him we would be leaving very early the next morning and he advised that we would have no problem getting our car. At check-in, our Front Desk Agent was also very welcoming, professional and efficient. He asked what kind of bedding we needed and offered a very nice upgrade to an upper floor with a beautiful view of the city and the bay. He informed us of our dining options at that late hour and made sure we had everything we needed. We dined in the lobby restaurant and the staff were friendly and welcoming even at that late hour and so close to closing. Our food came quickly and was yummy, though we did not have much being so close to bed time. At nearly midnight, I found I had forgotten a toiletry and Housekeeping brought it to our room right away on request. The room was clean and very comfortable, the bed is lovely. Check-out the following morning was friendly and fast and our car was already waiting for us when we walked out the front door. The property itself is lovely and modern and clean. We come to the city often and would always stay here and recommend it to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff are always so great. The bed and pillows are so comfortable. It is conveniently located. Clean, contemporary property.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really!
review.locationRemarks: Nice location, right on the edge of Chinatown, just a few blocks from Union Square one way and the Embarcadero the other!

review.title: not a business hotel
review.reviewText: location is on fringe of financial district. actually hotel is more central for visiting chinatown. decor and facilities are geared toward chinatown visits and less for financial district/business. hotel is tired. room is noisy/lot of street traffic; hotel provided ear plugs next to bed for noise.

review.title: Will definitely return
review.reviewText: Stayed at the hotel for three days while attending a conference. Had a room on the 27th floor Executive level. Very comfortable room with a walk out balcony and a great view of the city. Enjoyed a light breakfast every morning and looked forward to happy hour and a variety of hot/cold appetizers in the Executive lounge on the 26th floor and meeting other guests. Very attentive staff. Hotel has now changed its complementary internet and charges a standard daily rate.
review.positiveRemarks: Very attentive front desk staff, executive lounge, daily paper, happy hour with hot and cold appetizers, lots of smiles from everyone
review.negativeRemarks: internet charges
review.locationRemarks: Very central, right in financial district, some great restaurants close to hotel

review.title: Good for Business
review.reviewText: Excellent location for business travellers without having to pay premium prices.

review.title: Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText: Check in was fast and I was greeted by a wonderful front desk agent named Evelyn. She was absolutely superb - friendly, cheerful and extremely helpful. Room was clean and bright with free wifi. Hotel itself is in a fabulous location - just 10 minutes walk to the shopping Mecca of Union Square. Would absolutely stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect! So close to everything - especially Union Square

review.title: Friendly
review.reviewText: Very friendly employees and always ready to help. Concierge was especially helpful!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to Chinatown!

review.title: Good food around. Near the shopping center.
review.reviewText: The hotel is near the China town. The restrant around it is super. My wife and I really enjoy the food. Macy, Neman Marcus, Apple store is not that far away. Take the car of the hotel cost only 15 USD. Though the hotel room is not big. It is good choice for a traveller.
review.negativeRemarks: room is small
review.locationRemarks: not far away from Macy and Neman Marcus etc

review.title: Nice quality, nice view, but drastic overcharging
review.reviewText: Hotel was great as far as quality, cleanliness, and customer service, but they drastically overcharged for everything other than room rate. Parking was $45 to park your own car down the street for one night. Valet parking was $55 for one night. Absurd. Also, the hotel charged $13 for a "continental" breakfast. Really? $13 for cereal? Even Motel 6 provides free continental breakfasts. Does Hilton really need to charge for a bowl of cereal? The rest of the breakfast options were so absurdly priced it's not even worth mentioning. We were better off heading into Chinatown to eat, or to the Warf where we could eat a full course meal of fresh caught seafood for less.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, view, and sports bar in lobby were outstanding.
review.negativeRemarks: Drastic overcharging for pretty much everything except room price.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, directly across from Chinatown.

review.title: Clean and acceptable
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the staff that I interacted with were polite, knowledgeable, helpful, and efficient. That said, it wasn't luxurious - but a good choice for a basic place to stay. The hotel provides ear plugs - you'll find a set on your nightstand and that's for good reason. The neighborhood is quite busy and the windows don't offer a lot of insulation from the noise. The ear plugs are one option, or you can use a portable white noise machine to help drown out the sounds.

review.title: Family from Oz
review.reviewText: We paid a bit more for a room with a view, even though it wasn't a full view of the bay, it was still good. The room we had was reasonably maintained, the bathroom was clean and nice with good quality toiletries. The location was central, it is just in the fringe of Chinatown, nice cheap food, handy during Christmas when a lot of restaurants were closed. You can walk everywhere from the hotel, 10 mins to Union Square and it only took us 20 mins to pier 33 and 25 mins from Fisherman's wharf back to hotel. Happy with the hotel, will stay there again.

review.title: Okay, but lacked luxuries.
review.reviewText:
Hotel was located right in the middle of Chinatown. From our window, we could see school children at recess playing on their asphalt playground and seniors doing ti chi in the park across the street. It was very interesting. The room was tastefully decorated although I would have appreciated a fan in the bathroom. Bed had a sway. The hallways seems outdated and dark. I wish they had a communal hot tub to help my poor feet after a long day of walking.
I probably would choose to stay in Union Square next time. I parked across the street instead of the hotel. They only charged $26 but had no in-out privileges. I got a great rate because I used Expedia mystery hotel promotion. Otherwise, I wouldn't have chosen this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: In the cultural center of Chinatown.
review.negativeRemarks: No perks for family like pool or hot tub. Very noisy in the morning from surrounding city.

review.title: Good location but don't meet our expectations
review.reviewText: We only get one towel and no bath mat on the first night. However, this hotel is in a great location (walking distance to/from union square, little Italy and practically situated in China town).
review.negativeRemarks: Not meeting expectation of "Hilton hotel"
review.locationRemarks: All we can say is good location !!!

review.title: Can't beat the downtown location
review.reviewText: Prime location, walkable distance to key downtown business and financial institutions, walkable distance to many popular tourist sites, or just a few steps from some OK Chinese restaurants. Has the hardwares of a 4-star hotel and charges as one, but somehow my 3-day stay felt more like a 3.5-star one. Bath towels were forgotten to be put in the room the first day, and hot water was temporarily unavialable the last day. It turned out, someone had turned a wrong valve. Both were very minor problems, and were corrected in no time with just a phone call or two. Parking was difficult as expected in SF downtown. Hotel parking is expensive. Luckily, there are plenty of public parkings nearby, and they are asking less than half of what the hotel would charge. Location, location, location. If they could smooth out their operations, this could be a 5-star hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Want to try Chinese food? It's just down stairs.
review.negativeRemarks: The overall up keep of the facility maybe slightly less than ideal.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown and financial district of San Francisco.

review.title: New year's eve stay
review.reviewText: Service was outstanding. First room had a funny odor but the staff immediately accommodated a room change. The second room's bed spring broke but again without question, they gave us another room. For the hassle, drinks and dinner was comped in the hotel restaurant. Very pleasant experience overall.
review.positiveRemarks: proximity to downtown sf, accommodating staff
review.negativeRemarks: windows could be a bit cleaner on the outside.

review.title: Easy access for great food and shopping sites
review.reviewText: Close to china town, Coit tower and union square, quick access to shopping sites and great choices for authentic cantonese food. Great rate too!

review.title: Good location and clearn rooms
review.reviewText: Stayed in this hotel for 2011 Christmas. The location is good for many attractions in SF. The rooms are well maintained and clearn. The staff in the entrance was a little rud when trying to make us move the car which was not blocking the driveway while we were unloading.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive hotel parking. Could use outside parking garages for almost half price.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Chinatown where there are plenty of Restaurants. Walking distance to the bay front, Union Square (shopping) and Coilt Tower.

review.title: Excellent hotel in Chinatown
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for one night, because all the hotels associated with my conference were booked. My room was spotless, the atmosphere was quiet and relaxing, and the beds were very comfortable. I think the wi-fi was free. Also enjoyed all the Chinese restaurants nearby. Good parking in the hotel and across the street in the public garage.

review.title: Not what I expected from a Hilton Hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms are a bit dated, needs renovation... won't go back

review.title: Good value in heart of the city.
review.reviewText: Hotel is in financial district adjacent to China town. Close to business locations and good restaurants. Easy walk to trolly line on California street. Staff is courtestous and eager to please. No real complaints only a caution: room service is expensive!
review.locationRemarks: North Beach - great restaurants and bars

review.title: san francisco
review.reviewText: this was noted as a hotel in the financial district of san francisco, more on the border of the district...but within walking distance. We did like the proxitmity to the italian district and china town. We try to take public transportation when we are there and it was at our front door. If you fly in I would suggest taking one of the shuttles from the airport to the hotel if you do not rent a car. Customer service has travel booklet with coupon for $11 per person, well worth it.

review.title: Definitely would go back
review.reviewText:
All was perfect with our stay. They let us check in early as well n hard fruit at the front desk. Stay was great. Hotel super clean. Only complaint, very minor at that is that the wi dows were not super clean, but i don't think there is much you can do about it at a high floor.
Breakfast was excellent. My toddler got to eat for free.
Great place. I would stay there again.

review.title: Best location to everything San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: The Hilton boasts a great reputation, but THIS Hilton surpassed even those expectations! Food, drink, service, valet...all superb! Walk to Chinatown, Financial District or even Union Square...my new Fave Hotel in S.F.!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, very clean. Would definitely stay there again if I can get a good deal
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is great for shops and Dim Sum

review.title: Access to Everything you want in Frisco
review.reviewText: I was impressed, i never seen china town the way i saw it from the 7th floor elevator lobby, i never knew it was that big, and we had personal access to china towns little park which was very interesting to watch the local chinese villagers. I also loved the view of the bay from our room and access to fishermans warf and union square all right there! this is a lovely hotel. in room dining was good. Fast service. Staff was nice. I would definately stay here again, and again, and again. Thanks!!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square for shopping esp. at the WestField Mall, Metreon, right down the street from that a out door park, a carousel, and a kid museum. Visit fishermans wharf, visit golden gate park, everywhere in SF is gorgeous! I love the city!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Noisy room, small bathroom, thin walls and did not get much sleep. The ear plugs should have been a clue which is quite sad given that this is a Hilton property. Not impressed.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square area

review.title: Great Bay View
review.reviewText: The view from our room was beautiful but in the first room we had no hot water, the handle for the water fixture in the sink came off in our hand and the tub drain out plug didn't work. After we complained we were moved to a room with an even more beautiful Bay view but the thermostat didn't come on until the batteries were changed, the shade screen was torn, the TV remote didn't work and neither did the lighted make up mirror.

review.title: Excellent combo of price, location and service
review.reviewText: This is normally a business hotel, but came on a weekend. It is nicely located, and was the best price, compared to others of its caliber.

review.title: Will come back next time
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the service was excellent!

review.title: North Beach / Financial District balance point
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay if you'll be working in the Financial District, but you also want to be able to have some food and fun in North Beach or China Town.

review.title: I would stay here again
review.reviewText: They are putting up a building that is about 18 stories high. If you want a Bay view make sure you say the Bay view and the most Eastern part of the Building. The college building just extends to the first two western rooms and up to the 22nd floor so I would assume the hight and more eastern side is what you want if you want a bay view. Bed was great, but TV a little annoying. There is an easy wireless internet access and plugs on the desk. The area is great in China town. Nice places to eat and drink. Every one is very nice from the Valet who ask if you need directions to somewhere, to the maids who present a nice smile which seems real and can be very talkative but not pushy and the rest of the staff is just waiting to help you enjoy your stay or to help you get where you want to go.

review.title: Cozy Hotel
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, be aware lots of construction was was challenging to get to at first. Hotel renovations are nice.....

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: The hotel's restaurant was very good. The staff was friendly. The only problem I had was that one of the beds broke while I was sleeping. Fell off it's hinge or backboard. Overall it is close to Chinatown, Embarcadero, & Financial District.

review.title: great location for a visit to a great city
review.reviewText: This hotel located right on the edge of China town and the financial district was a perfect location from which to launch our vacation. The staff were extremely helpful in particular the conceirge who had great recommendations for restaurants and how to negotiate the bus system. I also used the spa which was beautiful and relaxing. The breakfast buffet had an excellent selection and was an added bonus as I was unaware it came with the package! I would go back in a heartbeat.

review.title: Good location in SF
review.reviewText: We wanted to be hear the financial district and the Embarcidaro and this place was perfect. It had a nice restaurant which was convenient for a quick bite when we arrived in town late.

review.title: great service, and 45$ per night parking
review.reviewText: Lots of fun stuff within walking distance, take advantage of the parking you already purchased at hotel and hoof it!

review.title: Worst service/no wifi
review.reviewText:
Pro: central location near (connected to) China town
Con:
1. Expensive parking
2. No wifi, even near the front desk
3. Unconventional room configuration
4. Noise for rooms facing inward (top of other buildings)
Bad experience:
5. When complained about no wifi, unwilling to switch to a wired room
6. Called front desk, put me on hold, walked down to the front desk, the guy D J L is not doing anything and no other guest waiting (11:45pm)

review.title: Good North Beach Hotel
review.reviewText: Average for a Hilton - nothing special. Comfy room and within walking distance to so many good North Beach Italian restaurants and Chinatown Dim-Sum. Hotel service was spotty. The friendliest workers were housekeeping.

review.title: Way over priced
review.reviewText: Noisy construction. Toilet paper worse than a 2-star place in LA. Would try Japantown next time.

review.title: fabulous view; very central to wonderful food; Chinatown; North Beach
review.reviewText: we were warmly welcomed and given an upgrade from a room with no view, to one with a picture window framing Coit Tower

review.title: Love San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. The concierge even printed out information regarding building art throughout the city. We can't wait to come back ! I Highly recommend the City Sightseeing doubledecker tour bus. The on and off and all loop package was AWESOME !

review.title: Michael A
review.reviewText:
The property was very nice. We had a bay view which was perfect. If you are going there and want a bay view you'll need the top few floors or a room at the south end of the building due to a very large new building going up across the street. The property is next to China Town & within a few blocks of the Warf.
Perfect weekend getaway.

review.title: Wonderful service
review.reviewText: Staff greets you and are very accommodating to your needs. Close to Pier 39 a very walk-able location. I would love to go back!

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful receptionists. Center of the city but on the border of the busy Chinatown so you might encounter traffic going to and from the hotel depending on which way you're coming from. Rooms were decently clean and roomy. Shampoo and lotion brand was nice.

review.title: Great Price, Great Location
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was perfect. It's in between Chinatown and Little Italy. For food lovers like me and my family, this was perfect. We were craving for dimsum on our first night, and a block away from our hotel was a restaurant that served dimsum even for dinner. Little Italy, lots of great restaurants to choose from, too!

We also went here for shopping, and this was just a few blocks from Union Square. Quite a walk, but taking a cab would be fine too.

It was located across the famous TransAmerica Pyramid, and a block down is Francis Ford Coppola's beautiful green building. It was a location perfect for food lovers, shoppers, and great for sight-seeing.

review.title: i would stay again.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. We arrived early in the morning and was glad to find that we could check into our room.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText:
I thought the food was excellent along with the service. The staff seemed aware of the guests needs and veyr responsive. Room Service was attentive and very helpful.
The Concierge was always going the extra mile!
Thank you to all!

review.title: Blind SF Trip
review.reviewText: I purchased this night without knowing which hotel it was, and when I found out I was a bit skeptical. I was completely wrong. The hotel wasn't exactly where I had hoped, but the room was updated and comfortable, and the staff gave me the best service that I have experienced outside a Four Seasons Hotel. They were AWESOME. The management is doing a great job there. I would stay there again for sure.

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: I traveled to the Hilton Financial District with my husband and two children. We found a good rate, in a less touristy area, and hoped that it would be a nice two night stay. After checking in with a delightful staff, we got up to a beautiful room, with a nice view. The hotel is near Chinatown and Little Italy. My two young children, my husband and myself were able to walk to both areas and find great places to eat. We were also able to walk to trolly car stops, and even walked back to the hotel from Pier 39, via Sansome Street. At the end of our stay we found the Hilton was a great place to stay, with a very nice staff. We were very happy we chose this hotel. We will stay there again the next time we go to San Francisco.

review.title: Go for it if on sale
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and its location is convenient. Interior, room equipment and maintenance meets probably 3-4 star hotel overall. However, on-demand movies, parking are unreasonably expensive, shower in our room several times had problems with hot water (it was barely warm which is really inconvenient in windy SF). There is a major construction going on right in front of the hotel, even though we personally were not affected by the noise, also we had a weird message when arrived notifying us about possible inconvenience due to putting a film on the windows in our room. They didn't bother us but I didn't feel relaxed in that hotel. nevertheless, since we got a good deal - I would say I got a reasonable balance of price/quality.

review.title: Great Location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was my wife and my first trip to San Francisco. The Hilton Downtown/ Financial District was a great location. Multiple reasons why this was a great location. (1) Right on the edge of China town, 1 block away. (2) 3 - 4 blocks from the nearest cable car hop-on spot, which gets you to Union Square or Fishermans Wharf in minutes. (3) 15 - 20 minute walk to Union Square, which is where the start of the cable car line is, lots of shopping, and restaurants. (4) 25 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf. (5) 10 - 15 minute walk to Coit Tower. (6) 25 minute walk to Lombard Street. We planned to take cable cars everywhere, which is the easy way and close to the hotel. We ended up buying a 3-day pass (at Union Square Cable Car ticket booth) which gives you access to multiple modes of public transportation. The cable cars are a lot of fun but we ended up walking most everywhere. Great city for it. The hotel itself had a great location, very friendly staff, and modern feel. I would recommend trying to stay on the 17th floor or above with a North facing room. We were on the 24th floor of 27 with a North facing room. The view was AMAZING! The window took up the entire wall from left to right. The view was great looking at the the bay, wharf area, Alcatraz, and Coit Tower. I would definitely stay here again. It was right in the middle of everything we did.

review.title: Convenient but expensive
review.reviewText: The hotel needs bigger rooms and more elevators for so many guests staying specially on weekends

review.title: I liked this hotel a lot
review.reviewText:
this hotel is very clean and the rooms are decorated great.
lots of attenton to details. They even prvded ear plugs for a more quiet rest. I didn't need the pluhs.
close to chinatown and shoppng is in walking distance.
I would stay here again. Parking is expense if yoou a car.

review.title: Liked self parking
review.reviewText: Location was good. Parking for San Francisco was good with easy in and out access. Room was good size with view of bay and was quiet.

review.title: Can't call a cab!!!
review.reviewText: The room itself had a fabulous view however, the concierge did not bother calling a cab for any guests. We had to wait out in the front of the hotel and try to flag down our own cab. The concierge responded that the taxi cab companies are really busy and that they could not get through to them. I am not sure how valid that comment was but we ended up having to take our own car anyways. Also, trying to call the front desk or the concierge from our room does not work at all. We either got a voicemail or no answer each time we called. I think our stay would have been much better if the concierge was more considerate and if the front desk was much more accessible.

review.title: very nice and clean.
review.reviewText: We traveled during a busy weekend and we still had a very enjoyable experience.

review.title: Awesome!!
review.reviewText:
we had a great time staying at this Hilton in Downtown/Financial District . it is a very convenient location, safe neighborhood. Dim Sum @ City View restaurant was a plus. the bedding was so comfy that im thinking of changing my bedding at home now. you can walk to pretty much everywhere from this location. the taxi guy dropped us off @ the wrong Hilton (Union Square) which i was glad that it wasn't the hotel that i booked for, it is in a ghetto area that i wouldn't think of walking even during day time :). Over all, i love the Hilton San Francisco Downtown/Financial District. oh, i request for a room with nice view and the front desk guy moved us from 10th floor to 27th floor with balcony and bay view, what could be better than this??? we loved staying here.
cons; no hair dryer, not a big deal thou.
suggestion to hotel management team: the zip out option, I would like to hear something like "your check out is completed" or "you're now checked out" because after i hit the button, i didn't hear anything except for the "beep" which i wasn't sure if i am checked out or not. having to call back to the hotel just to make sure that i am checked out.

review.title: Ear plugs provide in the Room
review.reviewText: There is a 19 story building being constructed across the street from the hotel. The new building blocks the first few of the odd number rooms up until about the 21st floor. The noise from the construction/traffic was really bad one night -- didnt get much sleep. However, the building should be done shortly so the noise will be less I suppose. The hotel put earplugs in the room for your use. The hotel staff is very good - checkin and dining staff were attentive and very nice. I would stay again - but maybe after the new building is more complete.

review.title: Hilton SF on Kearny Street
review.reviewText: Great service, nice hotel and a fabulous bed! I loved the room service too...the Mac N Cheese was reasonably priced and very tasty!!

review.title: Best Weekend
review.reviewText: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Hilton/Downtown/Financial District, as it was within walking distance to my sons apartment. This is why I was ther as it was Mother's Day weekend. I enjoyed the magnificient view from my 20th floor room. The windows could have been a tad cleaner, but given the height, not me. I have been in other hotel rooms where you couldn't hear the people partying nex door. This was not the case though. Turning up the volume of the movie on the television, did help. All in all it was enjoyable. Hopefully next time when a smoking room is booked and a confirmation is given a smoking room will be provided provided. I also have never had to pay for parking when staying in a hotel, it was provided for you, but then I guess all of S.F. is looking for parking aren't they?

review.title: Perfect stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We have stayed here now twice and think it is great. The staff are very friendly.
We asked for a room this time with a view and it was incredible, panoramic of the bay, Angel Island and a beautiful, lighted cruise ship.
It was very convenient.
It is walking distance to North Beach for great Italian food and Chinatown.
We parked at a garage around the corner which was much less than the hotel parking garage.
(Tip: watch the clock, once you take the car back in the evening to the garage around the corner. For 1 minute over 12 hours, they charge another $12.)

review.title: A very nice hotel to stay in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed the room --- new, modern yet homey and cosy. I love the night view of the sparkling lights from the downtown high-rises from my window, so much so that I went to sleep with the shade up. I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Kevin
review.reviewText: very nice hotel. convenient to everything in the city.

review.title: Impressed with the excellent service on all levels.
review.reviewText: My recent experienced at the Hilton Financial District Hotel was positive on all levels. Staff members were cordial, professional and extremely accommodating. The Hotel offers many different services and is ideally located in heart of SF. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on business or for pleasure. I plan to stay again at Hilton San Francisco (Financial District) Hotel in the near future.

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: I have stayed at a few of the other hotels in the area of the Hilton. The Hilton staff was very helpful and friendly; and the facility was clean and well run. Great weekend, will stay there again.

review.title: Good location & Convenience to All
review.reviewText:
This is our first time staying here. Loved our room and location of the hotel because it just a few steps away from China town where you can get great Dim Sum.

The parking is $45/day which is outrageous since we are guests of the hotel. The service is excellent. I called housekeeping for extra towels while my daughter was in the shower and the towels came before she finished. This never happens to us in other hotels.

review.title: Perfect, absolutely perfect for us!
review.reviewText: The staff were welcoming, friendly and efficient. The hotel was immaculate, as was our room. The beds were comfy, the windows opened for fresh air, the room floor plan was very clever and useful. The bathroom was beautiful and my husband loved the water pressure in the shower! I especially appreciated the pocket door. I always wonder why more hotels don't use them to conserve space in small rooms. Breakfast in the lobby restaurant was fabulous, again the staff were wonderful and the food was very good. Located right on the edge of Chinatown and right around the corner from a fabulous Chinese restaurant that was open late to accommodate baseball fans after the game. The city seemed unusually quiet that night so we all got a good night's sleep. We come up to the city often for baseball games and stay the night even though we only live a couple of hours away. It makes us feel like we are taking little trips and getting away from it all. We usually look for the best deal available, but we liked this hotel so much, we might choose this over another if the price is still reasonable for a family of four. It was absolutely ideal for my family, but would recommend it to anyone.

review.title: beware of the parking
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nice and in a good location. Staff make an effort, although there seem to be a lot more of them in the morning than in the evening. There is major construction occuring on the north side of the hotel, and the very expensive overnight parking is too much for the area and makes the room price look less attractive.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Everything is good there

review.title: Very happy, can not wait for a reason to return
review.reviewText: Could not have been better, the hotel was great with wonderful service. The location is awesome, I was able to walk to all the sites and parts of town that I needed to be in.

review.title: Rooms are very nice. Very comfartable.
review.reviewText: Great rooms. Very clean, Comfortable bed. Nice flat screern TV.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great location and amenities and a view of the city. I would stay there again.

review.title: Will go back for sure
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Comfy. Best location.

review.title: Hilton at Chinatown
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the historical Chinatown of San Francisco. Well kept property and excellent location. They should make the whole hotel smoke free. Very annoying to smell cigarette smoke along those hallways, especially from the elevator to the room.

review.title: the perfect place within walking distance to everything and the best spa is there too!
review.reviewText: I love this place....TRU spa is awesome, the best and one of the oldest steak house's is within a stone throw away....near chinatown and union square...upscale people sinceit's in a business disrict.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a perfect location for us. Very, Very friendly staff. Everything we requested was handled in a prompt fashion. I would be happy to stay here again.

review.title: Typical Hilton Stay (5*s)
review.reviewText: Fabulous experience, always. Clean, pleasant rooms. Nice view. Convenient for the Chinatown parade outdoors. Great view of the city & financial district. Close to dim sum. Little bit far from the elevators, but worth the trek.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in good price! Excellent location! Recommend!

review.title: Eduardo
review.reviewText: Excelent room and services. But one of the beds were broken. We call the maintenance and they fix the problem. They also gave us a free film on TV.

review.title: Best spa experience we had in San Francisco (TRU spa)..in hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a nice location and the resturant/bar downstairs in the evenings is great! The spa TRU has excellent massage therapist and services. A little disappointed in the room, and the construction crane across the street eliminated a spectular view. Overall, the upgrade was worth it -- try the coffee at the Tully's in the main lobby -- its very good!

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: We found the Hilton to be well located to all areas, the staff was very personable and helpful. The room was clean and very comfortable, with a great view. The street noise was a minimum for the city.

review.title: SF Lovers
review.reviewText: Nice city.

review.title: Lovely hotel near City Lights bookstore
review.reviewText: We took a chance and tried the "50% off - name of hotel revealed after booking" option. The hotel was LOVELY, the rooms were absolutely charming. Everyone wanted to stay an extra day. It's just a block from Chinatown and, in a different direction, just a block from the famous City Lights Bookstore, so there was plenty to eat and read. And amazing views from the 20th-story windows.

review.title: Loved it, second time I've stayed there!
review.reviewText: After staying at this property four years ago I suggested we stay there on our recent trip to San Francisco. We were not disappointed. The room was wonderful and the hotel concierge and room cleaning staff were excellent. Restaurant recommendations were wonderful - we would stay here again.

review.title: Can't beat the price
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the cheapest hotels (aside from the dirt cheap ones) and it was on par with the costlier hotels. I did not expect to stay at that nice of a hotel for the price I paid. The room was spacious and had a very nice business area (a large desk with several amenities). The room was modern and had a great view. The location was right in the heart of chinatown and within walking distance of North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf, financial district, the Embarcadero, etc. Considering the price I paid and the central location, I will always stay at this hotel when I visit SF.

review.title: Niiiiice bed!
review.reviewText: I love this place... lovely touches, polite employees, gorgeous view, large comfy room/bed. Very loud construction was going on across the street, but a pair of earplugs thoughtfully left in plain view beside the bed solved the problem.

review.title: Top notch service
review.reviewText:
We had just come in after a long trip from ake Tahoe. Tired and cold, we were afraid that we might not a room. Our fear was confirmed whe we were told that the hotel was full. However, the front desk rep told us she will talk to her super and see how they can help me and my wife. She cam back after one minute and told us she will be able to get us a room. Talk about good quick service!
We got a room with a fantastic view of the surrounding community.
Hilton Hotel, thanks a lot.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Best location to stay in San Francisco, near to union square, china town and fisherman's warf....

review.title: Definitely would stay there again
review.reviewText: very nice staff, very helpful. located along the edge of Chinatown & right next to the Transamerica Tower, it's easy to walk to Coit Tower, Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, & (of course!) Chinatown. room was quite comfortable, too.

review.title: Perfect Location! Love this hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel used to be the Holiday Inn and then Hilton took over and remodeled it to be a beautiful hotel. We've been coming to this hotel location for years. It's right on the border of Chinatown. We take our toddler to the playground across the street too. This is only a few blocks from Little Italy and then around 1/2 mile or so from Union Sq. If you love walking, this is the perfect spot. The rooms are great because they are not as small as many SF hotels. You can get a great view of the Bay and Coit Tower too. There's even a rooftop pool. Chinatown is awesome. You have to experience Sam Wu's Restaurant. It's old school. It's a walk-up to the 2nd floor with a small room with tables and just stools, no high chairs. But, it's great cheap food that's been around for decades. It's two blocks from the hotel.

review.title: Matthew likes Expedia
review.reviewText:
Nice clean and quiet hotel, with good care
nice views, but parking is expensive, you can park across the stree for half of that $45

review.title: Bad location
review.reviewText: Immediately adjacent to Chinatown.

review.title: san francisco is awesome
review.reviewText: great city

review.title: Will most likely return
review.reviewText: I enjoy the accommodations at the Hilton, however I will say that the noise from the construction can be a huge inconvenience. The Hotel itself I would recommend to a friend, however if a friend is looking for a quiet place to stay to get work done and relax, I would not recommend this hotel for that purpose.

review.title: It was a nightmare!!! The restaurant hostess was disrespectful and rude.
review.reviewText: The hotel stay was good until we checked out and encountered the restaurant hostes, Glaire. She was disrespectful and rude. My 9 year old was in tears after she saw me very upset after the confrontation with Glaire. I have never in my entire life been treated so disrespectfully by a hotel employee. She humiliated me in front of my children and in the presence of the other guests in the hotel. I am still in shocked and my children keeps saying " I will never stay at the hilton...that lady was so mean"....

review.title: excelent
review.reviewText: Excelent and Expeious.

review.title: Worth a second chance.
review.reviewText:
Location is fantastic, service help 4 stars. Definitely will revisit this hotel.
However I had to wait for the room to be ready, call for maintenance as the shower/tub drain would not drain.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: All hotel staff we interacted with were rude and not helpful. Called down to the front desk a couple times and no answer. How can someone not answer the phone at the front desk? Hotel needs updating. Took forever to check in and check out because the front desk was not staffed adequately and were slow.

review.title: San Francisco North Beach / Chinatown
review.reviewText: Great location. Walking distance to North Beach and Union Square. Less than a 10 minute walk from BART.

review.title: North Beach is so noisy, I can't stay here again
review.reviewText:
The good news is that Chinatown and Little Italy surround this hotel. The financial district and Embarcadero are right down the street. HOWEVER, the strip joints and bars of North Beach are also about 1/2 mile up the street, and they are crazy noisy with people screaming, hooting and yelling from about 9 pm until they close at 2 a.m. At about 2:30, it becomes super quiet and you can finally get some sleep. We were there on a weekend, so I don't know if it's this bad during the week, but on Friday and Saturday night, it's very noisy.

No matter where you stay, go to the Farmers Market at the Embarcadero Ferry Landing on Saturday morning. It is amazing! Even tho' you can't bring all those fresh veggies and flowers home with you, you can enjoy the variety and beauty, and eat as many fresh tomatoes, fruits and oysters as you can while you're there. You must buy some bread from the Acme bread shop, it is the best you will find anywhere. And get some homemade jam and preserves from the guy and girl at the booth outside in front of the building, who package their fresh fruit jams in jars which are less than the maximum ounces to take on an airline, so you can bring them home (in your one-quart ziplock bag)!

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: perfect location

review.title: Convenient location; hotel itself is acceptable but not fantastic
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in the middle of Chinatown. I had been told by some SF locals that the neighbourhood was dodgy, although personally I didn't feel unsafe walking in the streets in daytime (I didn't venture out at night at all). A weirdo did get very close to me at one point and looked as if he was trying to grab me, but I was with other people so it didn't bother me that much.

There was a construction site right next to the hotel operating all night long on some nights, making it difficult for us to sleep.

Most other aspects of the hotel were satisfactory, but fell short of what I would expect of a 4-star hotel. Eg. Breakfast was not included. Key to my room stopped working in the middle of my stay. While it was rectified once I reported it to reception, it was an inconvenience. No fridge in the room. There was not even a kettle (there was a coffee maker, which only enabled us to boil two small mugs of water at a time, and the boiled water tasted like coffee stain). And then there was dust on the toilet in our room.

review.title: "The place to be if S.F.!"
review.reviewText: The hotel was top notch and located very close (walking distance) from Union Sq., ChinaTown, Amtrak, TransAmerica Pyramid etc. The only complaint was that the bridge connecting the hotel to the park seemed closed.

review.title: good choice
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful. The workout room was adequate. The surrounding area felt safe but a little off the beaten path. Close to Chinatown. It was fine for us as we were out and about most of the time - just need a good place to sleep.

review.title: Good location, no amenities in hotel.
review.reviewText: Happy to have spent time in SF but would not revisit due to having seen everything I wanted to see

review.title: Excellent for business travel, very good weekend getaway.
review.reviewText: This property is located within easy walking distance of all the major attractions and the rooms are above average in size for San Francisco. The location is great for a business stay and the rooms have huge desks with swivel chairs. It's everything you would expect from a Hilton, but look elsewhere if you are looking for a luxury property or a boutique experience.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: One Block from Chinatown, and close to a double decker tour bus stop!

review.title: San Francisco thru the eyes of Hilton-Financial District
review.reviewText: Hilton made our first San Francisco trip memorable. The bellboys were very warm and helpful, same as the people at the Concierge. Housekeeping made sure our needs were met, with attention to details.

review.title: Outstanding hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It's really great to stay at this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel. Bargain sale. Would definitely return
review.reviewText:
The hotel was conveniently located in walking condition to many local tourist attractions: museums, shopping, restaurants. The staff was friendly and professional. We felt safe and secure at all times. Our room was very attractive and clean: a four star hotel at bargain prices. The concierge answered all questions and gave us great suggestions which turned out to be on target. We would definitely return, especially when there is another rate sale.

Parking was very expensive but conformed to other hotels in the area.

review.title: Not Accomidating Hotel.
review.reviewText: Well, on the day of check in we arrive about 4:00 pm and the room was not ready. We had to wait for 45 minute. They did not compensate us at all for this not free breakfast or anything. However there were men who were checking people in and offered some hot chick free breakfast and all but we got nothing. I guess I wasn't hot enough. Anyway. We would not stay there again. Hotel was not bad but their customer service really could use some WOW.

review.title: Expedia came through in a pinch!
review.reviewText: We where really happy with the service...It was totally last minute. No other agency could find us a room in the city at all...we called for 2 hours trying to find a room, with no luck....called Expedia and Bang done! She found us a room for our son we where able to prepay everything for him no problems..Expedia will be the first call next time! Thank you

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText:
very good location
very nice hotel
steep parking fees

review.title: I really liked this hotel
review.reviewText: My husband, son and I stayed at this hotel last weekend. It is right on the edge of Chinatown. When we checked in I asked the clerk to recommend a chinese restaurant. He sent us to the R&G Lounge which is almost across the street from the hotel. It was very good. We had 2 rooms. I consider the rooms to be on the small side, but very well appointed, up-to-date and clean. I especially liked the built in desk in front of the window. I didn't notice any construction in the area as mentioned in earlier reviews. If you stay here and are an early riser be sure to check out the morning exercises going on across the street in the park/square. On Saturday morning they even had swords! It was really cool. I definately recommend this hotel.

review.title: Convenient, but not the best location; clean and comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: Convenient, but not the best location (right at the edge of Chinatown); clean and comfortable rooms but the externals of the building are unimpressive. We booked our room by expedia. We were upgraded to a high-floor room with minimal fuss. Unfortunately the WC was broken. The repair man was very helpful and professional. We were moved to a room on 25-th floor (which we requested). We were given breakfast coupons as compensation. Overall all, a pleasant experience.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: I satisfied with the stay except for a few things like: parking fee was not included, front desk floor was not very roomy, etc. I guess these are usual in this area.

review.title: San Francisco Hilton Review
review.reviewText: Our stay was perfect. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the room was spectacular. We had a very comfortable bed with an awesome view of China Town. The rates were really reasonable. I would stay there again for sure.

review.title: Reliable Service - a great hotel
review.reviewText: Helpful, friendly and attentive staff. Comfortable Room with fantastic view. Superb food - restaurant quality but expensive. Excellent internet connection. Good location. No problems at all.

review.title: Chinatown Hilton
