review.reviewText: This hotel is adjacent to Chinatown, but out of the bustle of Union Square. It is set up to accomodate business travelers with a great desk and computer connections on the desk rather than on the floor. I've been staying here since it was a Holiday Inn, and stayed at several hotels in SF over the years, always returning to this one.

review.title: Construction
review.reviewText: Currently there is construction going on around this hotel. The work is being done at night time (machines are on all night) so don't go without ear plugs. I would stay in another Hilton if you have the choice.

review.title: Excellent location, excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The restaurant in the hotel was not bad either. Convenient parking garage. All in all, a very pleasant experience.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: We were pretty content.

review.title: Not what I paid for
review.reviewText: Had a loud noise like a banging sound on the floor when trying to sleep asked to move to another room they did only to find out they put me next to construction with a jack hammer going for hours. Not happy at all.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is well maintained, and the staff was courteous. I was able to check in a little early, and they nicely gave me directions to North Beach. If you bring your car, park it yourself accross the street. Its much cheaper.

review.title: Not a nice hotel
review.reviewText: It is a first time I disappointed with Hilton hotels

review.title: china town
review.reviewText: n/a

review.title: Ok, not great.
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok and in a pretty good location, but no valet parking. The room was kind of dirty.

review.title: San Francisco near Chinatown
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean, the view is great, the service is good, and its just across the street from Chinatown.

review.title: The rooms are clean and the bed is soooooo comfortable. Can't wait to try a new hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms are clean and the bed is soooooo comfortable. The loss of the amenities will not make us come back.

review.title: Good deal for price paid
review.reviewText: Location was great! But for some reason, we got the handicapped room...and the bathroom was different than what we expected. Room was small...but that's San Fran. Water pressure in the shower was crazy low. Other than that, the hotel was a good deal for the price paid.

review.title: Short trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Although wireless internet was free, it took too long to get the connection.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Previous guest opened the water bottle in the room and drank it. And they put regular water. Wow... What a prank!!!

review.title: Close to Chinatown and walking distance to North Beach
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, parking garage across the street, close to Chinatown and North Beach...comfortable linens, pillow and bed....great views

review.title: I wouldn't go back
review.reviewText: Over all, I don't think I would go back. Parking isn't all the great either.. It's better to park across the street from the hotel, due to pricing of the hotel parking. The look of the hotel is very nice, but there will be contruction right next to the hotel. I don't know now that will affect the noise level in the area, but the view from our room which was the 15th floor was very nice. I don't think it's enough for us to want to come back due to the service and the inconvience of the double beds. The front desk clerk really should be trained to be professional at all times.

review.title: A bit far from nightlife.
review.reviewText:
Extortionate room service.
Inedible pizza - but got a refund no questions asked.

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: Old and out-date room, poor facilities, even no swimming pool, odd servant.

review.title: no lock to bathroom door
review.reviewText:
surprised to see
no lock to bathroom door

review.title: Don't like it
review.reviewText: Don't like the hilton financial district hotel. The room was so small. Everything in the room looked like cheap.The worst thing was that you had to wait for a long time for the elevators.

review.title: Great Location in a fantastic city
review.reviewText: Great hotel with free wi fi in the rooms (make sure you get the login details at checkin) and steps from the amazing restaurants of Chinatown, the bistros of North Beach and the historic City Lights Bookshop. A short stroll to Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf. For those coming in by BART from the airport, it's about a 5-10 minute walk from the Montgomery BART station.

review.title: perfekt
review.reviewText: nice hotel big rooms

review.title: convenient and competitively priced
review.reviewText: Wanted to stay in Union Square, but it was pretty pricey. The Hilton in Union Square was more expensive than the Hilton in the Financial District for the weekend. Turns out the Financial District Hilton is just a couple blocks from Union Square and one block from China Town. Great modern, clean hotel, and if you can get above the 20th floor you can have great views of Coit Tower and the bay. Moderately priced.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: There was major construction in the building next to the hotel. The whole one side of the hotel was affected by the noise. I had to move my room three times to find the best room away from the noise and construction and not compromise my view of the city that I paid for. In the end I ended back in my origional room, dealing with the noisey construction because I didnt want to lose the view that I paid for. I ended up having to stay another night that was not planned. The hotel made no accomadations for me with rates or with a reasonable room. I will never stay there again.

review.title: Think Again!
review.reviewText: $35 a night for parking was never disclosed also for a 4 star hotel they dont have a valet.. self parking in their garage which is also for public as well.. garage very durty and smells like urine...2nd the elevagtors are small and take for ever. so if you are staying on 20th floor and up, except long delays. the beds are not that comfortable either. will not stay there again.. im not sure why poeple would give this hotel a 5.. maybe the ones who normally stay at days inn or western inn..

review.title: financial district is great!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great in all, good location, nice people, nice accommodations. A small fridge in the room would have been nice. The sliding door into the bathroom did not give a lot of privacy and may be a problem for some but it didn't bother us. The best information I found on their website was the parking alternatives. using their own valet $54.00 or public parking across the street $27.00, I choose public. I usually stay at parc55 at Union Square which I really like so now I have 2 places in SF to choose from. Erik the concierge at the Hilton was really helpful in recommended this Breakfast place around the corner, it was great but I can't remember the name. I have been in the hotel business myself for 28 years and enjoy staying in different places.

review.title: Hotel Great - 2 Blocks away, Very Scary!
review.reviewText: The Hilton, Downtown Financial District is a delux hotel with all the amenities you would expect from the Hilton chain. However, just two blocks away is the "red light" district, and NOT a place to visit in San Francisco. Great location though to catch the trolley, to walk to attractions. I'd go again in a heart beat!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything we expected and more. Thanks.

review.title: Good value to stayed
review.reviewText: Good value on price, place and expectations.

review.title: very good hotel
review.reviewText: very good hotel, and the location was great too (closed to chinatown). The concierge was very helful.

review.title: china town during chinese new year
review.reviewText: We were in the heart of china town for the chinese new year. Our family enjoyed the luxury of the Hilton. A nicer hotel than we usually stay at but the Expedia rate is terrific. This is our second time staying here and we hope to do it again.

review.title: Mediocre
review.reviewText: Stayed here for Valentine's Day weekend which also happened to be Chinese New Year - BIG MISTAKE - firecrackers were going off all night since the hotel is located just up the street from Chinatown. There was also a lot of construction going on at the time. But the rooms were clean and the decor was modern and self-parking with in and out privileges was a cheaper alternative than valet. Enjoyed the free wifi.

review.title: Great location but can be noisy
review.reviewText:
We stayed 9 nights. Plus points are - great location (you can walk to most of the main attractions within 10-15 mins) and great service (concierge was especially helpful). On the downside it was a very noisy location. There is a construction site next door that started 7am on weekdays and the adjoining walls between rooms are extremely thin. In fairness when we did call down to report noise at 3am from our neighbours the front desk came up to the room right away, they do also provide you with a set of earplugs in the room in case the construction work is too loud (we stayed on the 19th floor and it was still pretty loud).

Would still recommend based on service & location but be prepared for some disruption/noise.

review.title: Good Hotel ,Good Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located very close to china town. It was clean and the staff were super nice.

review.title: We were very happy with the room and service we recieved especially for the price we paid.
review.reviewText: We would certainly stay again in this hotel @ this location. Every thing meant our expectations and more.

review.title: A definite come-back.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location within walking distance of the cable car. Our room had a view of Coit Tower, Alcatraz and the bay. The bed was very comfortable. It couldn't have been a better experience. We'll definitely stay there again.

review.title: Hilton Financial District's Review
review.reviewText: In the overall, you have an excellent service and very clean and comfy rooms. The only thing is that I was surprised the rooms didn't have DVD players, since I think is a very usual service offered by hotels. Nevertheless, great hotel.

review.title: Great value in San Fran
review.reviewText: No complaints at all with this hotel. Great views, comfortable surroundings, and good service. The hotel is close to China Town and other fun attractions. The BART is about 6 blocks away and you can easily grab a cab at the hotel. The beds were soo comfortable, liked the flat screen tv, and the ipod hook up. Bring your own water, because the Evian is $5 a bottle! :)

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The only problem with this hotel was that the electric plugs did not work either in the bathroom, or on the desk. The only place to plug in was where the coffee pot got plugged in. So I couldn't make coffee except before blow drying my hair and curling it. I had to plug my phone in across the room, and not be able to use that light. I mentioned to the desk when I left. It was a bit inconvenient, but for others I am sure it could be much worse. Hopefully they fixed that. Otherwise the hotel was very clean, convenient, and very helpful. I would certainly recommend it. And I would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Be back over and over again
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Great staff. But unless you have a lot of disposable income, plan on eating outside the hotel.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Good location, great service and a reasonable price. A better, more sociable bar would have been a plus. Service at breakfast was a little disappointing but there are plenty of alternatives nearby.

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Would be nice to have bigger gym and swimming pool

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText:
facility was good. but i didn't like the place right next to china town.

that takes my mood down definitely.

review.title: I picked the right hotel.
review.reviewText: Close to everything.

review.title: Rude customer service
review.reviewText:
The Hotel was OK but, the customer service was not.
Rude and not friendly.

review.title: Cleanliness is next to godliness
review.reviewText:
The hallways smelled really bad.
There was no coffee in the room even though there was a state-of-the art coffee maker. Only two towels in the bathroom.
Cleaning service was knocking on my door to clean the room at 9:00AM even on Saturday and Sunday...

review.title: Very satisfied.
review.reviewText: Everything I had expected for the trip.

review.title: The Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The best hotel in San Francisco, perfectly placed and with great views. All the staff and friendly and helpful. The rooms are well-appointed and practical, and the beds are very comfortable.

review.title: Walkers' Delight
review.reviewText: We spent our 43rd Anniversary and Christmas Day + here. Positively memorable experience.

review.title: Great views
review.reviewText: Rooms are fantastic. They are spacious, comfortable and affordable and have amazing views. Ate in the restaurant twice and was not impressed either time.

review.title: Don't bring your car!
review.reviewText: Great room, nice people, good location, outstanding view--but $50+ to park the car? That's CRIMINAL!! It's a nice place, but since I live in the Bay Area, I drive into the city, so I would probably try to a more car friendly place.

review.title: Hilton lives up to the name
review.reviewText: Hilton always does it right.

review.title: POOR LIGHTING IN ROOM
review.reviewText: HAD TO REQUEST EXTRA LAMP WITH BRUGHTER BULBS AS I AM VISUALLY IMPAIRED. BOOKED FIVE NIGHTS AND THE LAMP WAS 'REMOVED' ON MY 4TH NIGHT WITHOUT ANY EXPLANATION. STILL WAITING TO HEAR FROM THE HILTON.

review.title: Great Choice in Sketchy Part of Financial District Area
review.reviewText: As you walk from the train station at Market St towards the Hilton, the neighbourhood goes downhill very quickly. Don't fret though - rising up a pyramid series of stairs is the clean and modern Hilton. We had a well appointed room with great bedding, a quality bathroom and very good customer service. We attended a conference at a nearby hotel with comparable amenities and substantially higher room rates. The Hilton is close to Chinatown, but not near any other touristy areas. It's an easy 10 min. walk to the BART or other public transit.

review.title: Works for work
review.reviewText: Loved the desk for working!

review.title: Will be back!
review.reviewText: We were a little surprised by the location on arrival..not what we expected. We were given a room with double beds after we requested a king. We got to our room on the 6th floor and were wondering why the room came with earplugs. After the first night, I asked if we could be moved to a king room since it was our anniversary. We were upgraded to a king suite on the 23rd floor! We had a gorgeous view of the bay, Coit tower and Alcatraz! It was fantastic. The beds were comfortable and the staff was very accomodating! It is a noisy area and we heard sirens and screaming all thru the night. But the whole city seemed to be really noisy. We definitely plan on staying here again!

review.title: Not If You Want a Decent Night's Sleep!
review.reviewText: We stayed here based on its convenient location and the promise of a king room with a nice view. That much was delivered, and all was fine until about 3 in the morning, when the occupants of the adjoining room came in. They were not particularly loud -- but you could hear every word of their conversation through walls that must lack sufficient sound insulation. We figured at least we could sleep in the following morning. But their clock alarm went off at 7, and they kept hitting the snooze button every ten minutes for an hour. I have never before in a hotel heard a standard alarm in another room through the walls. The hotel must know of the problem, given the pair of earplugs that were lying on a bedstand. I complained the next morning to the one clerk on duty, and it was evident that she had heard similar complaints before. She said it must have been that the adjoining room had a common door (though it did not); that's an excuse you might accept from a $39/night hotel, not a Hilton. We had booked through Expedia, and even their intervention produced nothing -- they said Hilton even claimed that there was no record of anyone complaining that morning. (I guess when you tell the one clerk on duty that you just spent the worst night you ever had in a hotel, and provide the specifics I just gave, that doesn't qualify as a "complaint.") This is a nicely situated property but undeserving of a Hilton.

review.title: Good, comfortable base for exploring city
review.reviewText: Really good hotel for the price we paid, albeit it was an Expedia special rate. Bed was extremely comfortable and hotel was in a great location midway between Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square - good for exploring the city. Facilities couldn't be faulted and a very satisfactory stay overall.

review.title: Great view & location
review.reviewText: Haven't been back for ages and seems like they have done a great update from the Holiday Inn days. The view of Coit tower was excellent and location is easy to get to via car.

review.title: nicely renovated hotel
review.reviewText: this hotel has been nicely renovated. the room was extremely comfortable and the bed was luxurious. the bathroom was adequate. the only downside that i noticed was the long wait for elevators. otherwise, i would highly recommend this hotel for a business stay.

review.title: Like the view from the room
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in the midst of S.F.'s Chinatown and rooms offer views of an active vibrant cultural like of its residents. While working at the desk, I viewed a woman on a building rooftop hanging laundry! This made me feel happy staying at the Hilton!

review.title: Unbelievable view!
review.reviewText: My room overlooked the bay with the ships coming and going and all the beautiful sailboats.

review.title: It was just Okay
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, although not very luxurious...it was really small... last year i went to SF and stayed at the Hyatt and it was a HUGE difference. The hilton was smaller and everything just didnt compare. The quality of service was better at the Hyatt and it was cleaner and all for the same price, so you get more bang for your buck at the Hyatt.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Its a business orientated hotel (not surprising given its location!) so extras are a little pricey, but if you get a good room rate on Expedia then its got a convenient location for getting around San Francisco and provides a comfortable nights sleep.

review.title: One of my two choices every time we travel.
review.reviewText: We always consider Hilton as one of the hotels we prefer to stay. When we made our reservation with Expedia, there was a specific statement that we were going to have a king size bed. It was a little disappointment, the room was so little, the bed was a double bed, definitely not even a queen bed. The location was excellent though.

review.title: A good value for money + conveniently located
review.reviewText: Nice business hotel in downtown San Francisco. The entire building has recently been remodeled. The rooms are modern, clean and offer great views of SF. The hotel is within walking distance of Chinatown.

review.title: Nicer hotels for same price
review.reviewText: Hotel isn't in good location, isn't nearly as nice as it looks online, rooms overlook school playground so there is a lot of noise early in the morning, staff not very helpful.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Dirty rooms and lousy service. Overcharged me a day for parking and still have'nt corrected mistake

review.title: Very happy with my stay
review.reviewText: Good location --within walking distance to China Town. Very clean. Quiet. Comfortable beds. Would stay here again next time.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: the attention of all the employees there was the best, we really had a wonderfull vacation.

review.title: sleepless night
review.reviewText: i could not sleep all night because top of my room made noise like bed cracking sound. this hotel does not protect sound each room.

review.title: Good overall
review.reviewText: The stay was great and the location was awesome. Be advised that parking is an additional $18 per night in the hotels parking garage.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Good location with easy access to Chinatown, Union Square and Little Italy. Only frustrating problem was the room key kept malfunctioning so we would have to go back down 15 stories to the front desk to get a new one. It happened 3 times!! Otherwise a nice stay and a nice clean room with view overlooking the city.

review.title: what a great city!!!
review.reviewText: hotel was great and right in the heart of this great city, close to chinatown, and within wakling distance of the best part of San Fran...North Beach! This is San Francisco and the best place to eat, people watch, and shop. This is such a friendly city, even the homeless are wonderful!! I love this city

review.title: Great Location, Service, So-So Amenities
review.reviewText: We weren't spending much time in the hotel, so it didn't really matter that our room and the hotel didn't have some of the common amenities that a lot of other places have (like a mini-fridge in the room) but the room was modern and clean, our view was spectacular (bay view), and the location is perfectly situated between Chinatown, North Beach, Downtown, and the Embarcadero area.

review.title: Good Location but expected more.
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in a location near the financial district just south and within walking distance of Chinatown and North Beach. Easy to walk to North Beach that had very good Italian restaurants. Concierge was always very helpful with recommendations of where to eat. Overall the rooms are small (this was a family vacation with 2 kids and 2 adults). The availability of TV stations was limited especially during the evening hours. TV's are older and need to be upgraded (surprised for a Hilton Hotel). Occasionally hotel employee's were sometimes not very friendly with the exception of the various Concierge on staff. Also hotel does not have a pool for traveling families with kids.

review.title: Great hotel for San Fran
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location and if you get a high floor the view is wonderful (we were on the top floor!). Beware that it can be noisy at night - but then it is in the middle of a city - they supply ear plugs! It is a little bit basic for a Hilton, but then the rates are very good.

review.title: Great spa, service reasonable
review.reviewText: The check-in process and getting a taxi was very slow. The hotel lobby was very chaotic with people all over. The hotel was clean and rooms comfortable. The spa was fabulous and very convenient. It would have been nice to have a robe in the room for those going to the spa.

review.title: Not enough elevators for all the guests.
review.reviewText: Doesn't look like much from the outside but nice inside. If you get the executive level (over 23 floor), continental breakfast is included.

review.title: SF's Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We love this hotel. We got a room in 19 floor with a because city view. The room was very nice and clean. Staff were very friendly. Even though the parking fee is a little bit higher than other place but it's safer. If we have chance to go back to San Francisco, we will stay here again.

review.title: Concierge Desk
review.reviewText: The Concierge Desk is very helpful and can direct you to all the sites in San Francisco and save you money.

review.title: Positive experience
review.reviewText: Although we were on the 9th floor, the room windows allowed quite a bit of noise into the room from the street below. Made sleeping a little difficult

review.title: Nice hotel; excellent location
review.reviewText: Very good hotel, on the brink of Chinatown; clean room, excellent room service. Multimedia equipment a bit out of date (old TVs). Wireless service OK but no wired service (so important when You need to work via secure connection).

review.title: Towels fit for armadillos only!!
review.reviewText: Central location is excellent; hotel 'extras' are unreasonably priced; the towels were like sandpaper; front desk hospitality was lacking; consierege was often 'missing in action'; restaurant food options were forgettable.

review.title: Good location, reasonable rate, no problems
review.reviewText: This hotel is located close to the Transamerica Building, just on the edge of China Town. As such, it's a good base for sightseeing. If you're happy to pound the pavements then Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, North Beach and several other areas of interest are walkable. There are plenty of places nearby to eat, particularly if you like Chinese food ! We took the BART from the airport (just over $8 each) to the Montgomery Street station and then got a taxi to the hotel ($4). We didn't have a great deal of contact with the hotel, preferring to eat out rather than use their restuarant. The only very minor issue we had was that there were three of us in the room but only towels for 2 when we arrived. Quickly rectified by Housekeeping. Overall it met the standard you'd expect of a hotel aimed (I guess) primarily at business travellers. I'd happily stay there again.

review.title: Bad ...bad ..and bad....not a 4 stars hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived late at night, we saw a very big hotel so we think...wuauuuu we are in San Francisco....glamour...etc First: bell boy during the night does not exist. You must carry your bags.... tired or not. You have to go to a parking " very very expensive" and carry your bags alone...nobody helps you during the night. Receptionist: not friendly...it looks that they are making a favour to you. Hotel say "Wireless Free".......internet beyond the 10 th floor does not work. so we decided to rent a PPV movie and tried to be relaxed........the TV did not work ....i called the cable guy of the hotel .... ,,, he said " on the upper floors our signal is bad" so this is a high tower hotel ...but the services only work on the lowers floor? incredible. Conclusion: The hotel is very nice and clean, beds are very good, location is greate. guest service in general : bad bad

review.title: Check in chaos and delays
review.reviewText: This hotel has excellent rooms with a good level of comfort, and is well situated. However our whole experince was tainted by utter chaos at the room check-in. We (among many others)arrived following a transatlantic flight and queued repeatedly to check into our rooms, only to be told repeatedly throughout the evening that they had not been cleaned and were not ready. It took until well after 9pm local time (=5am with our jet lag) to be given our room by which time we were frankly desperate. A very poor reception for a Hilton

review.title: HILTON SAN FRAN
review.reviewText: would stay there again and recommend the hotel. it's walking distance to just about everything.

review.title: A good quality hotel at a reasonable price.
review.reviewText: The Hotel's location at the foot of China Town is good. You can walk to a lot from there. A better location for public transportation would be at the foot of Market Street. There is a BART station and many bus routes at that location. This was easily accessible from the Hilton, however.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: This is our third year in a row spending half a week in this hotel. Would definitely recommend it. Great location and all the comforts.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: Great place to stay in the heart of San Fran's Financial District. Within a few short steps of Chinatown and many many great place to shop and eat. Absolutely had a blast! Only complant was parking was over $50 a night :(

review.title: Noisy sleep
review.reviewText: The hotel does not have double glazing. In addition my room was right behind the elevator so noise from the street AND from the elevator. As I got a good rate value for money was still ok but I'd try something else next time in SF.

review.title: Good solid room in a great location
review.reviewText: Nice clean room in a very central location and a very reasonable price.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: Liked the location - on the edge of Chinatown. Would strongly recommend that you get a room on higher floor if you stay at this hotel. Room was smallish, but nice. It can be noisy at night due to proximity to Chinatown.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed there for our 5th anniversary. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is within walking distance to Chinatown. You Could walk to Union Square, Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39. But if you don't like to walk suggest using the public transportation way cheaper than taxi and renting a car.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: It is a great location. Easy access to anything you need or need to go to. Next time we go we just wont drive!

review.title: Wow, what a change!
review.reviewText: I stayed at this same hotel (the building at least) when it was a Holiday Inn. I can't believe it's the same building. The atmosphere from the moment we walked in the door was elegant, and the furnishings were beautiful. I kept trying to remember how it looked before. Congratulations Hilton Hotels, you had a great decorator. My stay was delightful.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Our room was elegant and clean. We had a great view of Coit Tower and the Bay. Customer Service was great. We had a bit of a problem with getting all 3 rooms together due to overbooking - but they accomodated us nicely and were extremely nice about it. It was nice that the staff remembered us and were very friendly. We would stay again.

review.title: Not Impressed!
review.reviewText: For being a "Hilton" I wasn't impressed. Our room wasn't ready when we checked in, the sink was broken, it was next to an empty lot that had contruction going on, and there is no pool or spa. I have had much more enjoyable stays with paying way less at other hotels!

review.title: View Enhancement
review.reviewText: The only thing I wish was better was for the windows to be cleaner. That may sound odd, but the view was breathtaking but I couldn't get over that the windows looked so grimy.

review.title: wonderful stay
review.reviewText: the only thing needed is glasses in room instead of paper cups

review.title: San Francisco for business
review.reviewText: The staff was very courteous and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Located right next to Chinatown, loved my stay, loved the location. San Francisco is a beautiful city.

review.title: Great rooms with great views.
review.reviewText: Rooms redone and have great views.

review.title: Great Location, Comfortable Accommodations
review.reviewText: This Hilton was the perfect location - right at foot of Chinatown (which we loved), close to the Ferry Building for the top-notch Farmers Market and close to all transportation links. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hilton was a great hotel. Very central for all the sights and next to Chinatown and Nort Beach districts for bars restaurants. Room was immaculate with all facilities you would expect from Hilton. My only complaint was i was in a roon next to the lift shafts and the lift noise was quite loud (from 5.30am to 1am). However, nothing that a pair of ear plugs didn't solve so didn't really spoil my stay that much.

review.title: Fabulous
review.reviewText: This hotel has had an extensive renovation and is beautiful. It is very clean and has very comfy beds/linens. The staff are friendly and helpful. Best of all it is close to Chinatown, Union Square and is about a 15 minute walk to Pier 39. It is a couple of blocks from the cable car and has a bus that stops out front if you don't want to rent a car (parking is quite expensive). I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Our next trip to San Fransico will definitely at this Hilton
review.reviewText: I cannot say enough about the comfort of the bed and linens. It was conveniently located in China Town and a short walk to Union Square. The young woman who ran the wine bar was so nice and we really enjoyed talking to her at the end of the evening. I will say the only issues we had was the male bar tender. He was rude, short, and was not pleasant to talk too. Not just to us but other people. It made us feel uncomfortable. the staff was great and the bellmen were fun and very accomodating.

review.title: would not go back
review.reviewText: we stayed for 2 nights and the room was ok, good size and the service was good. However the hotel restuarant shut at 10 and there was no room service at night. We had no mini bar in the room just a teasmaid but not even a kettle to make other hot drinks. The bathroom socket did not work or the light on the mirror. We also noticed room trays that were left out in the corridor all afternoon and evening.The best thing was the location which was central and excellent for walking to piers and union square.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Hilton. The location was perfect, we were able to walk almost anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is newly renovated and very nice. The only downfall was that outside our room (street noise) was very loud through the night.

review.title: Comfy with Great Service
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, great location, great service, comfy room ... no complaints!

review.title: I would not let my worst enemy stay here
review.reviewText: If they spent $55M on renovations they got ripped off. The walls were paper thin, you would hear the person cough next door, the bed was not comfortable, the bathroom was from 1983, and the service was horrid. When we went to check in at 5 PM 10 people where ahead of us in line, and they had one front desk clerk who was throwing all kinds of attitude. The valet parking was almost $50.00 a day. The bellman didnt speak english well, and the staff gave you the impression that you were in there way every time you asked for something. We wanted more towels and they asked us how many people were in the room staying, what a crock. Horrible service, terrible renovations, and rude staff. DO NOT STAY AT THIS DUMP.

review.title: great deal
review.reviewText: We didn't spend much time in the hotel itself, but I thought it was a great deal.

review.title: a pleasant experience
review.reviewText: the location was excellent,close to everything,walking distance to union square,embarcadero,china town,narket street and close to all buses and street cars. clean comfortable hotel with pleasant po;ite and helpful staff. would highly recommend it!

review.title: Handy Location - Great Views
review.reviewText: Stayed in an 18th floor King Bay view room which had an amazing view of Bay area and even a glimpse of Alcatraz in the view. The bed was very comfortable and the room clean and spacious. The aircon worked well and the room also had opening windows which was a bonus. Its an easy hotel just to come in and out and do your own thing. the staff seemed very friendly and helpful. The only downside is that there is no fridge in the room. The hotel is only 5-10 minutes walk to the main Market Street so you can use the Bart to get to the airport if you don't have too much luggage. ($5.30 to the airport). There is alot to see around the hotels local area itself and there is a 9X bus close to hotel which takes you direct to Pier 39. The bus runs frequently.

review.title: HILTON - FINANCIAL DISTRICT (san francisco)
review.reviewText: we arrvived in the LATE MORNING on Thursday. we were unable to get a room due to the early arrival so we checked our bags and went out for lunch. we were able to get into a room by 1pm. the staff at the front desk was very courteous and helpful. we were concerned with the bathroom as the bathtub was very slick and there was no grippy mat. we called down and did not recv one until the following morning. other than that, the stay was fine. the hotel is right at the start of Chinatown so food options were bountiful. you are a few blocks off of MARKET ST, but it is a nice walk. public transportation is right around the corner. no major complaints other than the slow response for some bathroom amenities and the lack of ink in the printers in the business center (had to print out our boarding passes). the desk manager was very cool and printed out our passes for us.

review.title: Below Expectation
review.reviewText: Probably because this is Hilton, we expected much better service than what we got. The front desk was not helpful as all. Slow service and wery long queue for check in. We waited for more than half an hour and were told that our room was not available. We reserved for executive level and and only lower floors were available at that time. And the front desk didn't even offer any solution - except that we have to agree to stay in a normal room. Waiter and manager in the dining place was not friendly either, in fact their rudeness made a lot of people unhappy. We tried to file a complain to the front desk and the answer we got was "I'm not sure what I can do".

review.title: Had a great and relaxing stay
review.reviewText: Previous reviews had me a bit concerned as they were quite erratic, but I found everything to be very comfortable and well maintained. The hotel is a bit further from Union Square than others I've stayed at while in SF, but this was still convenient. Transit is so good that it's still easy to get around any place you would want while visiting this great city. The staff and service were fantastic. The room was very comfortable even though it was the lowest level of room available. It still beat out many others in the city.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel - although pretty much in China Town. But a couple blocks from the financial district. Easy to walk around. Comfortable bed, great service, clean. Only thing to note is that you can hear children in the morning on a weekday :) as they are across the street. But all in all, a great place to stay.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: convenient

review.title: Simply, A Very Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location. Nice room. Friendly staff. Comfortable bed, nice amenities. Will stay again.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location to watch the Chinese New Year Parade. Rooms were a little small and we did not have all of the amenities (i.e, flat screen TV)as listed in the review of the hotel, but we were happy with the hotel in general.

review.title: Hilton? I do not think so
review.reviewText: If you are planning to have low grade vacation, choose Hilton in San Francisco. What thought to be a quality stay, turned out to be a mere dissappointment for me and my husband on New Year's Eve of 2009. Hotel's staff seemed to be overwhelmed with festive customers; therefore, they were definetely tired of accomodating me and my husband with a proper service. Our room was tiny and stinky; of coarse, we demanded another, but the general manager seemed also very annoyed and he was not willing to chahnge anything untill my husband explained him some basic notions about appropriate customer service. We have finally got a nice room. It all happened on New Year's Eve. People in the hotel were well drunk by 8pm, which was rather understandable for the holiday. We left for our party. On the return back to hotel on January 1, 2009 at 4am, we were greeted by several huge security guys, who had very little idea of an accepted human behavior outside of their home. Finally, I got so tired of all this commercilal corporate attitude, that I asked my husband to leave the place immedialtely. So we did. For you, my dear firends, I hope you will enjoy Hilton for us.But, think about what I mentioned above before acquiring your holiday package. Good luck!

review.title: Strange Location for High End Trendy Hotel
review.reviewText: The neighborhood around this hotel was run down and strange, not many places to eat at night within walking distance. The hotel staff - front desk - was very slow, and while accomodating, seemed unknowledgeable. The room, portrayed as an executive floor room, was nothing special and not worth the non-refundable special executive floor price. What was different, I don't know.

review.title: Bad
review.reviewText: Bad

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was right smacked in the Chinatown district where there were lots of Asian food to eat..Convenient to travel around..just hve to walk down like 3-4 streets and you will reach the Union Square and shopping areas. Only thing was that everyting in the hotel room had to be paid, including the mineral water (which some hotels provide for free). It was so expensive (USD$5.50 per bottle which i thought was crazy) Since its 5 star hotel, so i felt that some things should be free of charge. Cleanliness was excellent, the sheets were clean and bed was comfortable. Overall,the hotel is not as new as i thought but its good to stay there when there is a discount on expedia. Otherwise, it would be too expensive to book by phone.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: walking distance to china town and park for kids to play.

review.title: It was fine except for that first night
review.reviewText: My first night in the room-type is had booked was overbooked so I got put in a room adjacent to the elevator shaft. That is a friggin' ridiculous place to put a room unless you want to hear the "whoooosh" of the elevator cars all night long! Once I was relocated to the room I actually paid for and should have had in the first place, all was just fine.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great location to everything; wharf, china town, ferry terminal, little Italy / Ireland. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We were upgraded at check-in. Nice fire-place by the bar on cold days. Nice Italian restaurants just down the street @ 4 blocks, easy walk. Chinese restaurants just out the door. Two bus stops within 1 block.

review.title: Wonderful view of the Bay
review.reviewText: This hotel has a wonderful view of the Bay on the Bayside. The hotel is neat and has a modern touch. I see that in some reviews they say the outside does not look good. I care to differ. The inside and outside is impeccable. If you are into Chinese design you will love it. You may be tempted to stay close to the harbor to get a water view. I suggest staying here. You will have a better view a view of both sides of the Bay, but stay on the executive floors. Concierge was a dream he got me reservations to Alfred steak house even though they were booked up. You definitely want to eat there. I will definitely visit this hotel again.

review.title: Relax and enjoy the stay!
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the hotel. The staff was very professional and helpful. The only thing I did not like was the small bath tub. I feel that the caulk around it should look cleaner. That's it! And oh, yea! I was charged $54.00 for valet parking services that I did not get, but it was corrected befor I left. You know it just took time standing in line and pleading my case. I really did not need the extra stress at the end... I will probably go there again!

review.title: Good option
review.reviewText: Good option for a stay in SF at a very good location.

review.title: Great location; beautiful bay view
review.reviewText: Although the hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, it really is a wonderful hotel. Its convenience to North Beach - 3 block walk or China town - 1 block is terrific.

review.title: OK!?!
review.reviewText: OK but not great

review.title: Professionally run, nice place.
review.reviewText: Good experiences at check-in and throughout the stay. No problems with the room or other hotel services. Location is convenient for downtown business, shopping, dining and transit access.

review.title: Nice and very convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located in the financial district and Chinatown with nice and clean room with free internet access. They have nice meeting rooms at reasonable rates. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We asked for recommendation for places for Dim Sum in the Chinatown. They friendly staff gave us detailed directions and we were very happy with their recommendation.

review.title: Good place to stay......
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel located in the financial district of SF. Next door to China Town and lots of good food in the area. Staff was polite and helpful.

review.title: Comfy bed, convienent location
review.reviewText: This would have been a 5 star review except the toilet seat would not stay up. Fine if you are female, not so fine if you are male. One had to hold it up. Pleasant room service staff, nice appointments.

review.title: Greta place
review.reviewText: A great hotel in a perfect location for tourists in San Francisco. Just steps away from Chinatown,North Beach and the Financial District.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: iron wad dodgy, everything else was perfect.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I am not impressed with this hotel for the price. Rooms smell, bathrooms clogged.

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText: wifi in room did not work both nights I was there so had to do any work from the lobby. While using laptop in the lobby several others asked if the wifi was working, apparently wasn't working in their room either. Showerhead was way too low, I am average height but had to duck down when showering. The walls were so thin I could hear everything that was going on in the room next to me, including waking up at 5am to hear the neighbors. Finally, the breakfast buffe was terrible.

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: The hotel lived up to its reputation, great location

review.title: Must stay
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel! Beautiful view of the Bay. I loved the desk along the window.

review.title: Impressed! Free Internet too
review.reviewText: Great location. Close to China town, North beach, and a long walk to Fisherman Warf. The hotel was fresh and clean and upto date. Nice wine bar and coffee bar in the main loby/ Great views of the bay from our room on the 22nd floor. We even walked to the Coit center. The staff was friendly. Self parking was convient. I forget what it cost? Parking can be very expensive in S.F. area. Hope to go back soon.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Smaller type of hotel, close to china town and financial district. The bathroom is a bit dated otherwise verynice hotel. Good service and not far from the city centre (15 min walk). THE offer was definitely value for the money. Moscone centre is approximately 15-20 min walk

review.title: works very well for the financial and convention areas.
review.reviewText: Good rate

review.title: Good for business traveler
review.reviewText: Have stay here a couple of times. Hotel is clean and staff is friendly. Room service a little pricey, but food is good.

review.title: Rooms OK, hotel is depressing
review.reviewText: Hotel looks like a concrete throwback to the soviet era. The rooms are fine, the hotel is self is not really all that up market. The location is sketch, the hotel bar is very unappealing. Better hotels close by.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Older building outside, but really nice inside. Guest Services was extremely helpful, and the room was very comfortable. In-room safe was a nice addition. Price of food on-site was high, but good quality. Good location on the edge of China Town and the Financial District; walking distance to many attractions. Would stay again.

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: Got a good deal from expedia on this hotel. Attended conference at Moscone. Easy 10-15 minute walk. Stayed on 23rd floor in executive room. Nice. Ask for a room further from the lifts as the ice machine is the noisiest thing. I was lucky as I wasn't too close. No minifridge in room. I would ditch the icemachine and put in a few fridges.

review.title: Nice choice
review.reviewText: The hotel is right at Chinatown and was very comfortable. A little difficult getting in and out but I stayed there two days for business meetings and would certainly go back again.

review.title: thumbs up
review.reviewText: hotel was great, prompt service, great bayview from our room!

review.title: Very disappointed
review.reviewText: I travel on business trips at least once a month. I have stayed at many Hilton hotels around the country, and am a member of the Hilton Honors program. This hotel has many of the conveniences and standards of other Hilton hotels around the country - the rooms are good sized, clean, and the beds are comfortable. What I was shocked to find at this particular hotel was the extremely poor service. The snobbery was almost comical, till you realize that you are paying a premium price for substandard service. Ask for advice on a good restaurant to dine in - no help. Ask about what activities are good for visitors - "Go to Chinatown" (pretty nonspecific). The final straw was when I was trying to check out and wanted to clarify something on my bill. I and two other travelers waited in line for 45 minutes for two receptionists to stop talking to each other, and when I mentioned to the concierge that it was disrespectful for us to wait so long, he promptly told me that all personnel were busy. This would have sounded better had I not looked into the back office and seen three others happily chatting away. The time - 9 am on a Monday. When it was finally my turn, I even mentioned to the receptionist that "I'm sure that the corporate office wouldn't approve". The response - "Sorry, hope you have better luck next time". Not if my life depended on it. Do yourself a favor - spend your money wisely on another hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel, in a fabulous city.

review.title: Central Hotel with helpful staff.
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be a great base for exploring Sanfrancisco, within walking distance of most of the sights. The helpfulness of the staff with any problems was excellent.

review.title: very nice and quaint accomodations.
review.reviewText: cozy room. clean. nice location.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Chinatown in San Francisco is one of the largest chinatown in US. This hotel is really close to the chinatown. So, when you wake up in the morning, just take a short walk, and you'll enjoy a great dimsum for your breakfast. The downtown is also in walking distance. So, it's nice.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: right in chinatown and short walk to the warf and even shorter to north beach...rooms have great views..... great location for vacation travel without a car

review.title: Bad choice
review.reviewText: We felt unwelcomed from the first moment we entered the hotel. I guess they are not used to having international travelers in their hotel!!!!!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Very good value just steps from North Beach and Chinatown. Clean and comfortable. Nearly as nice and half the price I paid to stay 6 blocks away at Union Square the week before.

review.title: Noisy at night, but conveniently located next to Chinatown
review.reviewText: The interior of the hotel is really nice, but the exterior is old. As a result, the hotel rooms are nice, but the windows are very thin and it gets really noisy at night, especially if you are at one of the lower floors. I loved the location - being right next to Chinatown - even though I don't think it may be too safe late at night in that area. I wouldn't leave your car parked on the street overnight. However, It was so wonderful to be right next to so many wonderful restaurants and bakeries in Chinatown.

review.title: Recommended with a fix!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, the room was very nice. Our one gripe that was never resolved while there was absolutely no hot water. We called several times and were assured the problem would be fixed. Cold showers combined with chilly San Fran are not good plus the problem was never fixed.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Not perfect but very nice. The staff is most responsive and helpful!

review.title: Very clean comfortable room
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and informative. Hotel was very accessable to many attractions. Great shopping within walking distance. Wonderful restaurant next door.

review.title: Highs and Lows
review.reviewText: Loud. Very loud, even on the 15th floor. There was a bar or restaurant across the street that must have emptied their "empties" every 15 minutes it seemed and it sounded as if they were in the room with me. No towels in the room when I first arrived, although, this was quickly rectified. I had forgotten my power cord for my laptop and called to inquire if they had another available (being a "business" hotel, I actually expected they would). They did not. That's not the issue. The problem was finding a human to talk to. Once I did, they kept trying to explain the room had "wireless" internet. Finally, the concierge understood what I was requiring, but, alas, was no help. The room, though, was clean and comfortable. The restaurant (Seventy-Five or Seven-Fifty??) left a lot to be desired. I would stay there again, because, compared to the surrounding financial district hotels, it was a good value. Just be sure to bring your own power cord.

review.title: Excellent Hotel, Fantastic Views!
review.reviewText: Overall, this is simply a superlative hotel located in a dynamic, centralized area convenient to Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach dining, and not far from Fisherman's Wharf. The amenities, staff, comforts and everything just totally satisfied! Will definitely stay in the S.F. Hilton Financial District again!

review.title: Would like to go back in the future
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the cleanliness of our hotel room as well as the hotel in general. The concierge was very helpful during our stay.

review.title: Nice hotel. Don't plan on printing here.
review.reviewText: This Hilton SF Financial District used to have the more descriptive name Hilton Chinatown. It's an older hotel with a very nice remodel. This translates into larger rooms than in the newer places, but that feel new. Beautiful views from the Bay side. I am very sensitive to noise and the room was super quiet - and I know there were lots of other guests on the floor. The staff bend backwards to make guests happy. The business center was disappointing - very expensive to use, stocked with very low quality toner and paper. The photocopier was broken but still charged me to investigate whether I could get it to work, since it charges by the minute, not by the page. I got my money back but it was very problematic to not be able to print handouts for an early morning meeting. Luckily a photocopy store is within a few blocks.

review.title: Very, very enjoyable business trip
review.reviewText: SF FS Hilton was really wonderful. The hotel itself is very attractive, modern, and clean. My room had a beautiful view of the bay, plenty of work space, and many creature comforts. The all-day conference was catered in-house and the food was excellent, both breakfast and dinner. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Great local attractions in the historic Financial District and a block from China Town.

review.title: Elegant, great location
review.reviewText: Elegantly renovated hotel with top-of-line look & feel. Great views from upper floors.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The valet parking was extremely poor. It is required if you want in/out priviledges. On the day of our departure our truck had a dead battery. It delayed our leaving until it was fixed. An inexperienced valet did not know how to turn off our truck completely and the battery was allowed to run our of power.

review.title: Good deal, great Location
review.reviewText: pro's Location; cant beat it, close to North Beach, extremely close to Chinatown, nice walk to Union Square, very good food locations surround this hotel. Bed was really comfortable, tough to get up in the morning after long walks :). Spacious Bathroom, nice view from room. Con's the hotel can use new carpets, new painting for a 4 star hotel. also our last night there cleaning service was not very helpful,

review.title: A Superb Experience
review.reviewText: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent! Fantastic location in the financial district but also with stunning views of the bay (and within easy reach of all the attractions). Also close to shops and in the heart of Chinatown. The room had free wireless access, pindrop silence at night, a clean and tidy room, pleasnt staff, and good quality food (which is always a bonus in a hotel). In summary, a very positive experience.I travel extensively for work and this was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

review.title: not impressed at all
review.reviewText: Bathroom sinks were clogged , The room was very small although we have requested a king bed we got 2 full/?queen beds with minimal area left for two people to walk to the closet etc.... The bathroom door would not close proprly and the room smelled like cigarettes dspite our request for a non-smoking room. I only rate this hotel as a 2 to 3 at most and will not recommend this hotel to anyone of my friends.

review.title: Excellent value in high-priced city!
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful - the staff was very courteous - even the valet staff was helpful and interested in assisting us in choosing options that were more economical (i.e. leaving our car parked there after we checked out so as to take advantage of the parking fee we had already paid) while we continued our site-seeing on our last day. the hotel is located right on the edge of Chinatown and within blocks of the cable car stop, although it is an uphill walk. We thoroughly enjoyed our vacation and would stay here again.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Very impressed with this hotel. The rooms were on the smaller side, but other than that...no complaints. The beds are to die for. I would stay there again. Very pleased.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my stay, we booked two days on december for the holidays, the hotel is very nice, the room is clean and beatiful, you hace Chinatown in front, the Finantial District on the side and two block fom the Italian District. The only thing I didn't like was that I didn't get the non smoking room requested.

review.title: Convenient Location in the Financial District
review.reviewText: Hotel was within walking distance of every place I had to go to in the Financial District. Was also a short walk to the Montgomery BART station. Room had a nice work space. Only complaint was that free wireless internet service was somewhat slow.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The Hotel is very clean, beds are comfortable. one thing I did not like was the bathroom door does not lock, besides that everything was satisfactory.

review.title: Extremely Comfortable, Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great choice. The staff was friendly, the room was extremely comfortable and clean, the price was unbeatable, and it was a lovely stay.

review.title: Loved it... !
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel... very clean. The staff was friendly. For an extremely reasonable rate.. we stayed on the top floor overlooking a gorgeous city/bay view of the Coit Tower and Alcatraz. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Comfort Plus
review.reviewText: Enjoyed 3 nights at the Hilton and looked forward to relaxing in the evening after a busy day. Stayed on the 27th floor in Executive room with gorgeous view of the bay. Room very well appointed and I appreciated the wireless access. The concierge level amenities and the availability of some light breakfast selections in the morning was super. Perfect for those of us on the run. Staff at the hotel was very attentive and friendly as would be expected at a Hilton. From check-in to check-out it was a very good stay.

review.title: It's a great hotel
review.reviewText: At first I didn't think it was all that great. A slight problem with parking as usual. When we arrived at the hotel, valet guy was not friendly. We asked nicely to park in front of the hotel for check-in. He said we could not park there even for a couple of minutes. Other than the hotel stay and its surrounding areas, I definitely recommmended because Chinatown is up the street and Union Square also a walking distance. It was pleasant after all.

review.title: Was satisfied with the location of the hotel
review.reviewText: Our hotel was in walking distance to Chinatown and the Ferry Building. Transportation by Bart & taxi was very convenient. Drinks in the hotel bar were over priced and the small lobby coffee shop seemed to always be closed. The hotel rooms were nice as well as the bedding. We did wake to trash trucks in the alley on Monday morning. I would stay there again.

review.title: Very good hotel!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel. We spend a very good time there.

review.title: Great facilities, horrible service.
review.reviewText: The rooms were very clean and of decent size. The service, however, was horrible. The front desk lady was soooo rude to my party and I and refused to give us a room(we got there 15 minutes early). When we went up to a DIFFERENT front desk lady, she gladly gave us a room, which made the first woman throw a fit IN FRONT OF US. Our baggage was to be taken up to our room, but was left unsupervised in the middle of the lobby for about an hour. One of the nights we had an extra person staying with us...the cleaning room threatened to tell the front desk if we asked for extra towels.

review.title: kindness hotel
review.reviewText: good price and location

review.title: A good baseline for other hiltons-very good
review.reviewText: Excellent value and location worked for us-central to many points of interest and significantly more upgraded than hilton union sq where we stayed previously. Good security-card key floor access and quality in-room coffee. free wi-fi.

review.title: not recommendable
review.reviewText: lower quality than I expected. no minibar, small room, poor heater and expensive parking fee. But I was impressed by concierge. she was very kind and excellent.

review.title: Excellent, convenient hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: The hotel is excellent: - clean, crisp sheets - comfortable bed - clean carpets - hot shower - free WiFi - proper lighting - power outlets that are properly positioned on the desk - right next door to Chinatown for good cheap food - efficient and professional staff

review.title: Great service, small noisy room
review.reviewText: The location is good if you like the hustle-bustle of downtown. It's right next to Chinatown, if you like that. Chinatown to me is basically lots of small shops selling lots of cheap junk, and food that scares me. The hotel service was excellent. It's a short walk to the cable cars, so we did not need a car. We stayed on the 12th floor on the south side. The windows must be very poorly insulated because the noise from the trash trucks at 4AM every morning was unbelievably loud. I could here every bottle crashing out of the dumpster. The emergency vehicle sirens made me feel like I was standing on the street as they went by. We would have enjoyed the bar which looked very cozy and fun, but we saw the price of the martinis and went out instead. Even though I'm 6 ft-2" tall, the shower heads were placed ridiculously low. They were just below my chin. My 5-7 wife actually knelt down to shower. Overall not bad, but not one we would do again.

review.title: Terrific stay. Great views of Bay.
review.reviewText: All was great, except parking. My wife plus grand-daughter and I arrived seperately, they for one night only. On departure the parking people didn't understand the billing arrangement -- one night -- and were not courtious. This bothered both my wife and grand-daughter.

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: If you are in San Francisco for business or pleasure, this is a great place to stay. From SFO you can catch the BART to the Montgumery St station, and you are only about a 8 or 9 block walk through the financial district to the hotel. The hotel sits right at the north end of the Financial district, so getting to any place down there is a couple of minute walk away. For leisure activities, you are 2 blocks from Columbus ave, which has many great restraunts and eventually hits Fisherman's Wharf. You are also only 4 blocks from California street where it is easy to catch the famous Cable Cars. From there you can ride up Nob Hill, and catch another Cable Car route to put you into Union Square, or take you all the way to Fisherman's Wharf. (Also runs right across Lombard street, which is really a site to see!) From the Cable Cars you can catch a great view of Alcatraz also. Once on the north side, you are very close to the Golden Gate Bridge. The hotel itself is right next (read: across the street) from China Town. The Italian district is also just a short walk. (4 blocks or so) I loved the hotel bar, the people are very nice, and the food is great. Also a recommended stop would be the San Francisco Brewery (Corner of Columbus and Kearny, only a 2 block walk), they have some great ales and lagers on tap! I would recommend this place for anyone that needs to do some business but would also like to get out and have fun.

review.title: Some basics missing
review.reviewText: While this hotel looked nice and the service was more than satisfactory, Hilton seems to have overlooked a few basics. Our room was on the 9th floor, but our windows were clearly not very well insulated. We were awakened each night and at 4:30 most mornings by a garbage or delivery truck in the alley below. If too expensive to replace the windows during a $45 million renovation, why not at least provide alarm clocks with a white noise option? No such luck for us. The shower in the remodeled bathroom also left something to be desired. It was only about 5'6'' tall, meaning we had to duck under to wash our face or hair. Not the most relaxing experience. Getting to other parts of town was also difficult, as the hotel doesn't draw many taxis to its location on the edge of the Financial District.

review.title: Street Noise at Night
review.reviewText: Poor sound proofing from the street even above 10th floor.

review.title: really friendly staff
review.reviewText: We thought that the location was great, close to everything that we wanted. The staff were so accommodating. The concierge's were excellent and funny. We had so much fun talking to them. They arranged a car rental for us and we toured Napa, we totally recommend this!!

review.title: Comfortable, modern and nicely appointed
review.reviewText: The Hilton was not our first choice but turned out to be very comfortable. It's located on the edge of Chinatown and the Financial District. It is convenient to Union Square and the Embarcadero. Easy walking distance to both. The rooms were clean,fresh and comfortable.

review.title: We'll return to this hotel
review.reviewText: Great location -- lovely decor -- very friendly, helpful and personable staff who made our stay very enjoyable. Set up beautifully for business and family travelers alike.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Great alternative to Union square since you're close to Chinatown (across street from hotel), Little Italy district is about 4 blocks away (Stinking Rose is good place to eat), Wharf is 1.5 miles away. Hotel was very clean and service was good. Elevators were a little slow.

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was very nice and professional. Whenever we needed a taxi, one of the guys would be right out there waving down a taxi for us. Room service was quick and they were very nice making sure we had everything we needed.

review.title: In the right location
review.reviewText: great walking area around Chinatown. Hard to get a cab at times though.

review.title: Great location, particularly for the financial district
review.reviewText: Right on the edge of China town and 6-8 blocks from the Financial center and BART. Friendly staff with quick response to problems. Well maintained. Good food in the hotel and in the surrounding area. The room was a little smaller than I usually expect, though I understand is common in the city. Free wireless internet. Good security: Security key required to go up in the elevator or to stop on a different floor going down (including the workout room floor). Its a long walk to the Wharf or the trolleys, but its a short taxi ride (and cheaper than the trolley if you don't hop off/on all day). You can see the hotel from most places in the city, so we always had a landmark for heading back 'home'. I would certainly book this hotel again, especially at the Expedia rates.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: The location was very good, out the front door and your in Chinatown, around the corner and you in the Finiancial District, go a couple of blocks and you are in Little Italy. Many very good eating places within walking distance. The Staff was very courteous and helpful, rooms were clean. I normally like a firmer bed, but this was the best softer bed we had ever slept in. We were on the 23rd floor, on an end room. We didn't have the huge window but the view was awesome. Out our window we could see Alcatraz and Coit Tower.It was sunny and clear everyday of our stay. We purchased the Hotel, Plane and Car, alcatraz Trip and the Go San Francisco Card. Everything went without a hitch except for the Go Card. The contractor/vendor, that you get it from, at he pier, sent us to the wrong place and told us the wrong bus to get on, and it went down hill from there. We spent the better part of an afternoon/evening trying to get where we were supposed to go and by then no more tours for the day. So I would stay away from the Go Card. But that was the only downside of the trip. As for the parking, yes it is pricey, we knew that and figured it in our expenses.

review.title: San Fran Hilton
review.reviewText: Beautiful interior, good service. Unfortunately the street noise (party goers, garbage truck, breaking bottles), made it difficult to sleep well for my entire stay. Ask for a higher level room-above the 11th floor.

review.title: expected better service
review.reviewText: room was clean and stylish. front desk was fine but bell service was rude. just expected more from this class of hotel.

review.title: romance is dead, but not in san fran.
review.reviewText: the desk was very very friendly and helpful. we had a room on the 21st floor which we saw an incredible view...buildings that resembled new york. we were right in the heart of china town so there were lots of cheap meals, there's one restaurant the lounge a couple blocks away. u must go. u could wake up in the morning and walk about 10 minutes to sit and enjoy soup or whatever with a sight of bay bridge or go to the marina and get all those city tours or cruises. the duck tour was great. i guess the location, the view and the room's accessories, nice bed, refreshing shower head, everything's about 10 minutes away except for the ocean bay which is definitely a must go and golden gate bridge otherwise it's quiet, peaceful walking distance from shops, historic sights....good stuff for the price.

review.title: Far reaches of the Financial District
review.reviewText: The Hilton should receive an award for the design of this hotel and the guest rooms. The rooms were nicely appointed with new high thread count linens, new work spaces and wonderful bathrooms (oddly enough the LCD from the photo tour was missing). As others have mentioned in other reviews, you can definitely hear the streetscape below, so keeping your windows closed or requesting a high floor would be advisable. There was one thing about my stay that I was slightly disappointed with--the location. This hotel is touted as being in a central financial district; it's not. This hotel is in the middle of Chinatown. I enjoy the idea of being in a culturally diverse area, but I am not sure the misrepresentation is appropriate.

review.title: Great Price!
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel merely because of the great rates. I booked about a month in advance and paid a very low rate for such a wonderful room. The view from our room was absolutely amazing! The decor, modern and inviting. I was not happy with the room service. I

review.title: A great spot and very comfortable.
review.reviewText: We had a very nice experience. The proximity to Chinatown, bus routes, and trolleys was great. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. We were only half way up but had a great view (sort of--my son _really_ wanted to see tall buildings so we got a city view which he liked but the bay (Nob Hill)view would likely please most folks more). The front desk staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. The only negative was street noise which was noticeable but not really intrusive. I hardly could hear any of our neighbors (both rooms aside us were occupied).

review.title: will definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: At check-in, we received upon request a fantastic room with a great view of the Bay. We also received 2 complementary bottles of water and access to the concierge lounge, which hosted a continental breakfast in the mornings, and cocktails and complementary hors d'oevres in the late afternoon. We did have trouble with our television, as the movie channels were not working. They responded promptly and we were offered a different room. Great hotel...

review.title: Convenient, Comfortable, Quality
review.reviewText: Room wonderfully appointed, including internet & business services, if needed. Convenient walking distance to financial, shopping & theatre districts, North Beach/China Town.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: More info on local night life.

review.title: Nice hotel!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and nice!! Definitely will go back again!!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: A great hotel for business but not for a tourist. The rooms are beautiful and the service is great. Location is better for business travel since it's in the financial district. Tourists might want to be a little closer to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel- perfect location ! Everything was great except for the $50 a day fee for parking-but otherwise exceptional!

review.title: A Little Late
review.reviewText: Overall all I would have to say that the this was a great choice for me. It was right next to chinatown and north beach for some great food and places to go out at night. It also was not to far to get to the cable cars or even fisherman's wharf. The only negative remark that I can make about the hotel was that after a long flight I expected to be able to check right into my room when I arrived at the hotel at 7 pm and rest. Unfortunately the room was not ready. I went around the corner got a bite to eat and it wasn't until about 9 to 9:30 that the room was ready. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Very nice, modern, and clean hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel is indeed very nice! The rooms are very clean and spacious with comfortable beds. We had a city view room which wasn't bad. I probably would stick to city view next time, beacuse I dont think the price difference for the bay view is worth it. It's foggy most of the time and you can always admire the view while outside. The only thing I was not satisified with was the TV. It was not a flat panel as advertised!! Just a regular tube!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great hotel in convenient location stradling Chinatown, Financial, and North Beach. Short walk to cable car connections. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and the concierge service is especially good. I had a double on the city side with what I consider an awsome view... some might argue that buildings aren't interesting, but I loved it. I highly recommend this hotel for visitors who want to be out of the busy Union Square area -- the neighborhood around this hotel is very walkable even at night. Also, the beds were extremely comfortable and the room was spacious.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I also booked a facial at Truspa and even though the price was a little outrageous I thoroughly enjoyed the spa experience. Although our room was a little cramped I would go back to this hotel.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Excellent service, comfortable rooms, close to shopping and great food. You won't be disappointed.

review.title: a pleasure
review.reviewText: Well maintained hotel in a convenient location in SF. Friendly staff, cozy (but smaller) rooms, no complaints at all.

review.title: Very clean and friendly staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is near to the downtown area. friendly staff with reasonable price. I would stay there for my next visit.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Incredible views, extremely comfortable beds...this was an excellent hotel experience.

review.title: Rocking City View
review.reviewText: Our hotel was in the center of all the fine dinning and night life. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: Superb service, superb hotel
review.reviewText: Was treated so well at this hotel and as a single traveller felt totally safe. Great location for most amenities including downtown shops as well as 'touristy' area of Fishermans Wharf. Short walk to cable cars, short walk to Embarcadero. Easy to find as it is next to tallest building in SF! The hotel staff were extremely accomodating and friendly. Will definitely return to SF and to this hotel in future.

review.title: Wish I had returned to this hotel when I was back in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The hotel is extremely central location-wise and boasts a very modern design. Staff are very friendly and really go out of their way to help out with planning excursions etc. Clean hotel, room, gym and other facilities. Would recommend it any time.

review.title: Won't stay there again.
review.reviewText: Right from the time you land it gives a bad feeling for the price you pay to stay here. Hotel has a small lobby, the hallway leading to the rooms are shabby.
