The carpet has not be changed since they opened. No privacy in the room too. You can hear your neighbor's TV, talk over the phone plus lot more.. Won't recommend anyone to stay here.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel service was the best i've seen in a while. Everyone was very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Close to Chinatown too!
review.reviewText: While this hotel claims it is in the Financial District (which it technically is), it is actually right on the border of Chinatown. Perfect location!

review.title: Magical
review.reviewText: I love San Francisco. My wife and I had a room on the 26th floor with a bay view. If we didn't have other things that we wanted to do in the city, we could have just spent hours each day staring out the window. A beautiful hotel in a beautiful city.

review.title: New Year's Eve in the City
review.reviewText: What a great time! My husband is a restaurant manager in the Financial District and had to close on New Year's Eve, so we got a couple of friends to share a room and to join me for dinner while hubby worked. We are all "foodies" and have been in the hospitality industry for almost 20 years, so we know good service. We were very impressed with the warm welcome and friendly service that we experienced with every employee that we encountered. The only two sore spots of the entire stay were: 1) the soda machine on our floor ate my change, and when I called the front desk for a maintainence person they transferred me around to 2 other extensions and then finally into the voicemail of the hotel manager - who never returned my call (it was only $1.75 in change, so I didn't sweat it, but it was still a bit frustrating at the time); and 2) there is a very strong, "funky" mildewy smell in the bar/lounge area, which made us want to finish our drinks quickly and vacate before the smell transferred to our clothes. Aside from that, we would definitely recommend this hotel based on service and comfort.

review.title: Not too shabby.
review.reviewText: Overall I liked the hotel. The rooms aren't very well insulated from outside noise such as car alarms, sirens, etc. but overall all it was very clean and nice inside. I would more than likely stay there again, you probably can't beat it for the price.

review.title: So Comfortable and Relaxing
review.reviewText: We had 2 double beds with 4 pillows on each bed. Great view from the 23rd floor. Close to North Beach, Chinatown and a nice walk to Union Square. Nicely decorated. Great room to hang out in. You might want ear plugs because the noise from the street does rise up into the rooms

review.title: Very good accomodations;
review.reviewText: excellent location; friendly, attentive service; very clean; vending machine on my floor was broken for the entire duration of my three day stay at the hotel ( a minor inconvenience)

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The service I received from the Hilton San Francisco Financial District was outstanding. The Conceirge recommendations were all great! The hotel staff were incredible. In this hotel it is evident that customer satisfication is their #1 priority.

review.title: good location, nice place, service needs to improve.
review.reviewText: close to everywhere, modern-contemp place, nice view, but you need to ask for the service you expect to recive as a paying costumer.

review.title: Great Location.....
review.reviewText: ....If you can ignore the littered streets and the building site next door. Other than that the Hotel itself is great - on the edge of China Town, great restaurants nearby serving a variety of ethnic cuisines and only minutes from Union Square. Staff were courteous and rooms fine. Great for a weekend get-away.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Had to change the room twice - first time it smelled of smoke and the second time the bathroom door was broken, as was the heater. No one answered at the valet or it was busy. Seemed to be understaffed do deal with the amount of people staying at the hotel.

review.title: Great Location !!
review.reviewText: I stayed at this Hilton for a medical conference. It was centrally located, giving access to China Town, great restaurants, San Francisco attractions, and restaurants. Thank you!!

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had not previously stayed in the financial district, so it was fun to do something new. The rooms in the hotel were quite spacious and tastefully decorated. Ask for a high room for views and noise control.

review.title: Very clean
review.reviewText: I really liked the cleanliness of the room and the view was beautiful. The bed was extrememly comfy and big, my boyfriend loved the huge flatscreen t.v. and the location was good. However, it's right on the edge of chinatown and if you walk in the wrong direction it puts you right in the ghetto...but if you go the right way you get to shops and everything in five minutes. The parking was horrible and expensive, park in the lot across the street for 25 bucks or you will pay upwards of 45 bucks a night at the hilton. All in all we loved it.

review.title: Hilton Financial District great location
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel with a great view. The staff was wonderful and the bed was very confortable. The location was close to everything. I will stay there again.

review.title: wonderful!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location..the entire staff was VERY FRIENDLY..and very quick to respond to our requests.. the view was incredible!! if you stay here, its a MUST to get a room with views of SF...

review.title: Nice option in Financial District
review.reviewText: It took quite a while to check into the hotel, it was understaffed at the counter. However, the staff is cordial and the rooms are very clean. They do tend to be smaller, but, they were really relaxed. I like this Hilton better than the one closer to Union Square for personal travel, it feels less "corporate" and has a better intimate setting near the loung and bar area. I would stay here again.

review.title: Gem at the crossroads of Chinatown, NorthBeach
review.reviewText: Hotel has been renovated and has modern rooms that are very conveniently arranged for the business traveler. Work surface ran length of the room under the wall to wall window that overlooked the Bay, Coit tower and Sts Peter and Paul Church in North Beach.

review.title: Great Accomodations
review.reviewText: Accomodations are dearly comfortable and classy. The Zen inspired decor is modern and elegant and a perfect taste into the adjacent china town.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: Only had a minor problem with the in-room coffee - was all decaf, but there is a Tully's coffee bar in the lobby (even better). With just a 2 block walk, you are in the middle of Chinatown. Not a far walk from the shops of the Financial District. I highly recommend getting the transit map from the front desk, the cable cars are a great way to go! If it's too cold to stroll the streets, the room service is fabulous!

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: Great location walking distance to North Beach, Union Square, China Town 2 blocks away. $7 cab ($1.50 bus ride) to Wharf - 2 miles approx. Hotel staff was the best. Great recommendations for "local" restaurants, sights, directions. Muni transportation system excellent, EASY, SAFE. One of the best experiences traveling!!!! Room is a little small (not too small), great view, large work center (desk) overlooking city, extemely comfortable.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly & helpful. Rooms comfortable with pillow top beds!!!Elevator extra fast(up to floor 20 in about 5 seconds).Nieghborhood felt safe. Always staff outside to greet you therefore there weren't any "drifters" waiting to approach you.

review.title: Great Views
review.reviewText: Spectacular rooms with great views of either the city or the Bay

review.title: Chinatown Hilton
review.reviewText: Overall I was very satisfied with my stay at the Hilton in Chinatown. It is walking distance to most placed in San Francisco. It has a great veiw of the Bay from both sides. However the odd numbered rooms have a better view of the bay. Every time I go to San Francisco I book my stay at the Hilton because of the comfort and feel of home.

review.title: Room with View & More
review.reviewText: I traveled to SF for many years and this was by far the best accomodations value yet. It was my wife's first time in SF so I upgraded to the Bayside View and it was worth every penny! The Bed was delightful with full comfort down pillows.Rooms newly remodeled Jan 2005 very elegant. Hotel resturaunt was exceptional in service & food offering but it's SF & pricey. Great Location to China Town, North Beach & the Wharf (brief walk or Muni Transport).

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Central location to all major SF landmarks. Nice, comfortable hotel but need ice machines on each floor.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great location, great service, reasonable price. The bed was too soft not very comfortable.

review.title: Very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: Very convenient to the sights of San Francisco. Very quiet, except for sirens, but hey, we were in the city. No coffee maker in room, but coffee shop in lobby had excellent coffee.

review.title: Great Hotel on the edge of China Town and the Transamerica Building
review.reviewText: General manager and others took real good care of me. Their restaurant is great; food is good and the modern ambience made my first day there a pleasure. There is a great steak place just next door in the alley. Alberts has been there since 1928. Big Steaks and the "Colonel" is the best bar tender I have found in a long while.

review.title: Great Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with friendly staff and nice rooms. Quite contemporary. The only flaw was parking, $42 a night!!. Better off with public lots across the street. Otherwise great location to all. Would certainly return.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel, not bad for three and a half stars. Good price, really nice service. Location's awesome, right in the middle of everything. Can walk a couple of blocks to Chinatown, a few more blocks to Union Square, close to BART stations. Will defintely stay there again.

review.title: Found everything about the Hilton wonderful.
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located and was quite beautiful. The rooms were up to date and decorately wonderfully. We would definitely return.

review.title: Great Location. WaLking Distance From EveryThing!!!!
review.reviewText: The room was very nice and clean. We stayed in the standard bay view room and the room looked just like the picture! The beds were also very comfortable. The location of the hotel was within walking distance to the main attractions ((ChinaTown, Pier 39, TollyTrains and Cafes/Restaurants)) which was very useful.

review.title: a positive experience
review.reviewText: Very pleasant, but some problem with noise level of neighboring room.

review.title: Can't wait to return
review.reviewText: Best veiw in the city! Stayed at all the others but if you want eye candy, THIS IS THE PLACE!!!

review.title: A very good hotel....will stay there again
review.reviewText: A pretty comfortable hotel.A very nice place to stay.Not in the best part of the financial district but the amenities provided by the hotel more than makes up for it. The rooms were kept clean and the associates were very helpful.Will definitely stay there in the future.

review.title: Is ok to stay this hotel only 2,3 days,
review.reviewText: The room and the service was ok, we have a small problem with the bath room on the first night. The food not "all that" but the room was clean.

review.title: Above Average Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel and people were nice. Any extra's are priced high. Wireless internet was $9.95 a day in the rooms, parking is $40. a day, water $4.95 a bottle in the room. And no coffee pot in the room

review.title: Good location & great room with a view.
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived until we left, the staff couldn't have been more courteous and helpful. The hotel was very nice and the room was well appointed. The view, a window the full length of the room, was phenomenal especially at night. The in house restaurant was expensive, but good. I would definitely book this hotel again for the confidence in service, comfort and convenience.
